name: Tristan Parker
text: I reached out to Two Men and a Truck for a quote on a commercial move. I received a phone call with in a few minutes asking me the details of the move and scheduled a time for a rep to come do a walk through and give a quote.  The quote was very reasonable considering the what we were needing moved. We decided to go with a week day to move as it is cheaper than Fridays or Saturdays. The guys showed up on time and work ready! I can not say one thing bad about our move yesterday other than it was so incredibly hot and I felt so bad for them. Fabulous job! Fabulous crew! Fabulous experience! Keep up the good work guys!

resp.text: Hi Tristan, Thank you for choosing the Movers Who Care and sharing how your recent move went. We truly appreciate it and are so happy to have helped make the day easier!

name: Nick Phillis
text:
ISSUE: Two Men and a Truck charged my card additional amount different from the final invoice WITHOUT permission. Management team did not always conduct professional business. See below:

We used Two Men and a Truck back in February. The crew did a decent job overall. They were hard working, the driver, Nate was exceptional. He had a great work ethic and was super professional and led the group.

My issue is with the management team. There was a discrepancy with the amount of time spent and the amount charged. The driver took off a little time from our final invoice because they spent an hour getting the electric bed upstairs. Essentially what he did was take off the $125 deposit from the quote. I felt like that was fair and I signed the final invoice. At that point I was happy with the move and we went on our merry way.

A few days later, I get an additional $125 charge from them on my credit card. Later that day, the operations manager who I believe his name is Joey, calls me to explain that he charged my card an additional $125 because I was quoted wrong on the final invoice. I explained to him that Nate took the $125 deposit off of the invoice because of the extra time it took them to move things when it shouldn’t have taken that much time. He explained to me that Nate didn’t have that authority and that I will have to pay the $125. I told Joey that I signed the final invoice giving them permission to charge my card for that final amount, in which he has no right to charge my card AGAIN without my permission. He then explained that he felt they have the right. If you give me a final invoice with an amount and I sign it, that is an agreement between the business and the client. A business has no right to change an agreement or amount after it has been signed by both parties. I got a call the next day from another manager to see how the move went. She was very nice and I explained the situation. I explained how I felt I was wronged in that my card was charged again without my permission, how Joey was unprofessional and does not conduct good business. She said that this information would be taken up the chain and people would be made aware. Ultimately nothing was done about it in the end. I just feel like it’s stealing when someone charges your card for an additional amount without permission. Just be aware.

resp.text: Hello Mr. Phillis, We're very sorry to learn of your recent move experience. With a 96% referral rate, we can assure you this is not the norm. We would be happy to speak with you further and encourage you to reach our team at 251-316-5977 so we may help.

name: Thatchic
text: Office staff seemed nice. Apparently they did not ask an important question. I was asked how many bedrooms and the number of items in each. I was also asked about living and dining room furniture. The guys showed up. One experienced, and one not. They started at one on, and by 3:30 they had only cleared one bedroom. My bedroom furniture is very heavy, and the guys were having a hard time. They informed management who brushed them off. I called with a concern about the time. I was told that my oak furniture was the problem. I was asked about quality of furniture on my initial call. This company moved this same furniture for me on a previous occasion. Anyway because of the time they had to leave some stuff behind and go to the drop off location. The supervisor eventually agreed to send help. Long after the mover told them of the problem. Initially I was told that I would have to cover this cost. Once the third guy arrived things went quick. He was experienced. My dresser was not able to be attached to my mirror because they left the screws for that at the location that I was leaving. So I have to find someone to do that. I live alone and don’t have a clue on how to do that. I did find the screws at the old address. I also found a complete mess left behind by the workers. At the new location, my living room and dining room furniture was just placed wherever. Three of my nightstands were left wrapped in plastic. I have plenty of pictures if needed. I do not fault the workers. When the worker informed the supervisor of the heavy oak bedroom furniture, assistance should have been immediately provided. Not later. They guys had to leave everything as such because of the time. I could not afford to pay $125 per hour for two additional hours. This is what was needed because of the wasted hours on the “heavy” furniture. Apparently they knew nothing about doing my move. It was a last minute surprise for them. They had just finished a job and was told that this job was only 12 items. Sounds like they were duped into it. Poor preparation on the supervisor’s behalf. Again I do not fault the movers. They asked for help at the onset and were ignored. They were extremely apologetic for the inconvenience. This is by far the worst experience I have ever had with a moving company. I will not recommend this company at all. I will also be contacting the corporate office. I feel like I was robbed. The workers deserved to be paid, because they did their best. They were exhausted. I feel like my cost should have been heavily discounted because the job is inadequate and incomplete. I have to pay out more money to get someone to help sort through the mess left behind. This move cost me $750!!!

name: Gypsy Spirit Underground
text: I hired them to move a business from a storage facility to a store front.  They completely underestimated the size of the truck needed and it ended up costing me more money cause they had to make 2 trips.  They measured and still sent the wrong size truck. After bringing  this to their attention they were to have a meeting and get back with me...NO RESPONSE, NO REFUND bad business.  Buyer beware..call someone else.

resp.text: Mrs. Ratajczack, first and foremost, I apologize that we didn't not live up to the standard of service you expected from us. I went back and reviewed your paperwork and contact logs and I wanted to hopefully clear up some items for you. All of our trucks are 26 feet in length. While we do have two "shorter" trucks in our fleet, it has to do with the height, not the floor space. We did go over on your original estimate by 30 minutes. While we always hope to hit the number spot on, we do sometimes miss and we thoroughly cover and explain to all customers how we bill on actual time used, not the estimate. This was covered in the pre-move email you received on 4/3/2018 and is also covered in item 1 on the Move Service contract that you and all of our customers sign before we begin a move.  Your move notes do say that our men "did a great job" but you were frustrated by the second trip that was made. I did not see however in those notes where a meeting was supposed to take place. If this somehow fell through the cracks, I sincerely apologize and will be happy to speak with you personally about the matter. You can reach me at the office @ 251-316-5977 or by email billy.stovall@twomen.com   While we never like to receive poor reviews, we will learn from it and hopefully improve our service to all customers. I appreciate you taking the time to leave it. Billy Stovall - Owner Two Men And A Truck Mobile, AL

name: Sarah McLeod
text:
3 years ago I used Two Men and a Truck and was very satisfied. Two men moved us from a house to an apartment across town, with a pit stop at a storage unit in between, in 2.5 hours. The guys were amazing. When I needed to move a couple weeks ago, due to my great experience previously, I chose to use this company again.

I don't know what has happened in the last 3 years, but I will never use this company again. They sent 3 guys this time, which would make you think it would take less time, right? No. I moved to an apartment that was 2 lights down from my then current apartment, and we again visited the storage unit, which is down the street from the new apartment. We basically went in a quarter mile triangle.  It took these 3 guys over 6 hours to move the contents of a one bedroom apartment and a small storage unit. They knocked off like 45 minutes for the break they took in the middle, so I paid for 5.5 hours total.

You may be thinking, how much stuff did she buy in that 3 year period?? The only difference between the first time and second time were 2 bookshelves, a chair, and a washer/dryer. With an extra person, they basically took 3 hours to move 2 bookshelves, a chair, and a washer/dryer.

I wanted to give these guys the benefit of the doubt, but after watching them visibly hem and haw at moving my stuff, visibly waste my time and money, I just can't. They mentioned that this company is under new ownership, which may be part of the problem. Maybe these guys get commission, I don't know. All I know is that I paid $925 to move a 1 bedroom apartment and a 5x8 storage unit a quarter mile down the road.

Do not use this company.

resp.text: Hello Sarah, we are so sorry your experience wasn't what you had expected and didn't live up to the high standards we have at Two Men And A Truck. We always try to exceed our customers expectations. I appreciate your review as we always try to use them to make our service better for everyone. Thank you for taking the time to do so. Best wishes in the future.

name: Nick Phillis
text:
ISSUE: Two Men and a Truck charged my card additional amount different from the final invoice WITHOUT permission. Management team did not always conduct professional business. See below:

We used Two Men and a Truck back in February. The crew did a decent job overall. They were hard working, the driver, Nate was exceptional. He had a great work ethic and was super professional and led the group.

My issue is with the management team. There was a discrepancy with the amount of time spent and the amount charged. The driver took off a little time from our final invoice because they spent an hour getting the electric bed upstairs. Essentially what he did was take off the $125 deposit from the quote. I felt like that was fair and I signed the final invoice. At that point I was happy with the move and we went on our merry way.

A few days later, I get an additional $125 charge from them on my credit card. Later that day, the operations manager who I believe his name is Joey, calls me to explain that he charged my card an additional $125 because I was quoted wrong on the final invoice. I explained to him that Nate took the $125 deposit off of the invoice because of the extra time it took them to move things when it shouldn’t have taken that much time. He explained to me that Nate didn’t have that authority and that I will have to pay the $125. I told Joey that I signed the final invoice giving them permission to charge my card for that final amount, in which he has no right to charge my card AGAIN without my permission. He then explained that he felt they have the right. If you give me a final invoice with an amount and I sign it, that is an agreement between the business and the client. A business has no right to change an agreement or amount after it has been signed by both parties. I got a call the next day from another manager to see how the move went. She was very nice and I explained the situation. I explained how I felt I was wronged in that my card was charged again without my permission, how Joey was unprofessional and does not conduct good business. She said that this information would be taken up the chain and people would be made aware. Ultimately nothing was done about it in the end. I just feel like it’s stealing when someone charges your card for an additional amount without permission. Just be aware.

resp.text: Hello Mr. Phillis, We're very sorry to learn of your recent move experience. With a 96% referral rate, we can assure you this is not the norm. We would be happy to speak with you further and encourage you to reach our team at 251-316-5977 so we may help.

name: Thatchic
text: Office staff seemed nice. Apparently they did not ask an important question. I was asked how many bedrooms and the number of items in each. I was also asked about living and dining room furniture. The guys showed up. One experienced, and one not. They started at one on, and by 3:30 they had only cleared one bedroom. My bedroom furniture is very heavy, and the guys were having a hard time. They informed management who brushed them off. I called with a concern about the time. I was told that my oak furniture was the problem. I was asked about quality of furniture on my initial call. This company moved this same furniture for me on a previous occasion. Anyway because of the time they had to leave some stuff behind and go to the drop off location. The supervisor eventually agreed to send help. Long after the mover told them of the problem. Initially I was told that I would have to cover this cost. Once the third guy arrived things went quick. He was experienced. My dresser was not able to be attached to my mirror because they left the screws for that at the location that I was leaving. So I have to find someone to do that. I live alone and don’t have a clue on how to do that. I did find the screws at the old address. I also found a complete mess left behind by the workers. At the new location, my living room and dining room furniture was just placed wherever. Three of my nightstands were left wrapped in plastic. I have plenty of pictures if needed. I do not fault the workers. When the worker informed the supervisor of the heavy oak bedroom furniture, assistance should have been immediately provided. Not later. They guys had to leave everything as such because of the time. I could not afford to pay $125 per hour for two additional hours. This is what was needed because of the wasted hours on the “heavy” furniture. Apparently they knew nothing about doing my move. It was a last minute surprise for them. They had just finished a job and was told that this job was only 12 items. Sounds like they were duped into it. Poor preparation on the supervisor’s behalf. Again I do not fault the movers. They asked for help at the onset and were ignored. They were extremely apologetic for the inconvenience. This is by far the worst experience I have ever had with a moving company. I will not recommend this company at all. I will also be contacting the corporate office. I feel like I was robbed. The workers deserved to be paid, because they did their best. They were exhausted. I feel like my cost should have been heavily discounted because the job is inadequate and incomplete. I have to pay out more money to get someone to help sort through the mess left behind. This move cost me $750!!!

text: I hired them to move a business from a storage facility to a store front.  They completely underestimated the size of the truck needed and it ended up costing me more money cause they had to make 2 trips.  They measured and still sent the wrong size truck. After bringing  this to their attention they were to have a meeting and get back with me...NO RESPONSE, NO REFUND bad business.  Buyer beware..call someone else.

resp.text: Mrs. Ratajczack, first and foremost, I apologize that we didn't not live up to the standard of service you expected from us. I went back and reviewed your paperwork and contact logs and I wanted to hopefully clear up some items for you. All of our trucks are 26 feet in length. While we do have two "shorter" trucks in our fleet, it has to do with the height, not the floor space. We did go over on your original estimate by 30 minutes. While we always hope to hit the number spot on, we do sometimes miss and we thoroughly cover and explain to all customers how we bill on actual time used, not the estimate. This was covered in the pre-move email you received on 4/3/2018 and is also covered in item 1 on the Move Service contract that you and all of our customers sign before we begin a move.  Your move notes do say that our men "did a great job" but you were frustrated by the second trip that was made. I did not see however in those notes where a meeting was supposed to take place. If this somehow fell through the cracks, I sincerely apologize and will be happy to speak with you personally about the matter. You can reach me at the office @ 251-316-5977 or by email billy.stovall@twomen.com   While we never like to receive poor reviews, we will learn from it and hopefully improve our service to all customers. I appreciate you taking the time to leave it. Billy Stovall - Owner Two Men And A Truck Mobile, AL

name: Sarah McLeod
text:
3 years ago I used Two Men and a Truck and was very satisfied. Two men moved us from a house to an apartment across town, with a pit stop at a storage unit in between, in 2.5 hours. The guys were amazing. When I needed to move a couple weeks ago, due to my great experience previously, I chose to use this company again.

I don't know what has happened in the last 3 years, but I will never use this company again. They sent 3 guys this time, which would make you think it would take less time, right? No. I moved to an apartment that was 2 lights down from my then current apartment, and we again visited the storage unit, which is down the street from the new apartment. We basically went in a quarter mile triangle.  It took these 3 guys over 6 hours to move the contents of a one bedroom apartment and a small storage unit. They knocked off like 45 minutes for the break they took in the middle, so I paid for 5.5 hours total.

You may be thinking, how much stuff did she buy in that 3 year period?? The only difference between the first time and second time were 2 bookshelves, a chair, and a washer/dryer. With an extra person, they basically took 3 hours to move 2 bookshelves, a chair, and a washer/dryer.

I wanted to give these guys the benefit of the doubt, but after watching them visibly hem and haw at moving my stuff, visibly waste my time and money, I just can't. They mentioned that this company is under new ownership, which may be part of the problem. Maybe these guys get commission, I don't know. All I know is that I paid $925 to move a 1 bedroom apartment and a 5x8 storage unit a quarter mile down the road.

Do not use this company.

resp.text: Hello Sarah, we are so sorry your experience wasn't what you had expected and didn't live up to the high standards we have at Two Men And A Truck. We always try to exceed our customers expectations. I appreciate your review as we always try to use them to make our service better for everyone. Thank you for taking the time to do so. Best wishes in the future.

text: These guys are truly awesome and good ole hometown folks that shown me empathic compassion and willing to go above and beyond, unlike the the other guys with trucks I called! Lackey's made my experience feel as if we were family and that's what I needed at that time! It was a last minute cry for help on my end and they were my saving grace! I will never search for help again, I will call Lackey's!

name: Lanny Norris
text: Daniel Lackey and his entire crew were better than advertised. They went above and beyond anything I expected. They moved us from Russellville to Birmingham the week before Thanksgiving without incident. They worked from 10:00 AM until 8:30 PM moving us out and from 10:00 AM until 6:30 PM moving us in. Everyone treated us like family and it seemed as though they thoroughly loved what they were doing. Also, their price beat everyone else I had talked to,  My wife and I highly recommend them.

resp.text: Thank you, Lanny! We are glad to offer our services and appreciate your business!

name: Robert A Cutrer
text: There was never a doubt about these men, or the owner, Daniel Lackey. I had a company scheduled and SML Moving was a no show without even a call. Called several but it was only one that stepped up to bail my wife and I out of a night mare. My wife had just lost her mother and her father past five months prior. Kind, considerate, and professional. I promise you you'll not be able to compare Lackey's teams to any because they've proven to me there's none better. Lackey's moved two large estates for us and saved our Hinds. Thanks Guys y'all are the best, hands down!! Rob & Beth Cutrer of West Point, MS

resp.text: Thank you, Robert! We were glad to help and appreciate your business!

name: Tristan Parker
text: I reached out to Two Men and a Truck for a quote on a commercial move. I received a phone call with in a few minutes asking me the details of the move and scheduled a time for a rep to come do a walk through and give a quote.  The quote was very reasonable considering the what we were needing moved. We decided to go with a week day to move as it is cheaper than Fridays or Saturdays. The guys showed up on time and work ready! I can not say one thing bad about our move yesterday other than it was so incredibly hot and I felt so bad for them. Fabulous job! Fabulous crew! Fabulous experience! Keep up the good work guys!

resp.text: Hi Tristan, Thank you for choosing the Movers Who Care and sharing how your recent move went. We truly appreciate it and are so happy to have helped make the day easier!

name: Nick Phillis
text:
ISSUE: Two Men and a Truck charged my card additional amount different from the final invoice WITHOUT permission. Management team did not always conduct professional business. See below:

We used Two Men and a Truck back in February. The crew did a decent job overall. They were hard working, the driver, Nate was exceptional. He had a great work ethic and was super professional and led the group.

My issue is with the management team. There was a discrepancy with the amount of time spent and the amount charged. The driver took off a little time from our final invoice because they spent an hour getting the electric bed upstairs. Essentially what he did was take off the $125 deposit from the quote. I felt like that was fair and I signed the final invoice. At that point I was happy with the move and we went on our merry way.

A few days later, I get an additional $125 charge from them on my credit card. Later that day, the operations manager who I believe his name is Joey, calls me to explain that he charged my card an additional $125 because I was quoted wrong on the final invoice. I explained to him that Nate took the $125 deposit off of the invoice because of the extra time it took them to move things when it shouldn’t have taken that much time. He explained to me that Nate didn’t have that authority and that I will have to pay the $125. I told Joey that I signed the final invoice giving them permission to charge my card for that final amount, in which he has no right to charge my card AGAIN without my permission. He then explained that he felt they have the right. If you give me a final invoice with an amount and I sign it, that is an agreement between the business and the client. A business has no right to change an agreement or amount after it has been signed by both parties. I got a call the next day from another manager to see how the move went. She was very nice and I explained the situation. I explained how I felt I was wronged in that my card was charged again without my permission, how Joey was unprofessional and does not conduct good business. She said that this information would be taken up the chain and people would be made aware. Ultimately nothing was done about it in the end. I just feel like it’s stealing when someone charges your card for an additional amount without permission. Just be aware.

resp.text: Hello Mr. Phillis, We're very sorry to learn of your recent move experience. With a 96% referral rate, we can assure you this is not the norm. We would be happy to speak with you further and encourage you to reach our team at 251-316-5977 so we may help.

name: Laury Rowland
text: Five stars are not enough for this incredible company! Wonderful to work with from the GM Denise to the guys who moved the washer and dryer! So much more that expected and so much more community orientated than most will ever truly know. Give them all your moving business!!

resp.text: We are so pleased to hear that you are happy with your experience.. Thanks for choosing TWO MEN AND A TRUCK!

name: Denise Alawine
text: Had the BEST experience with this company. From setting up the move to the delivery was nothing less than perfection. The office staff was the most informative, professional, and courteous ladies I've ever dealt with. The moving crew was spectacular and deserve a raise. Those guys work HARD! They were very professional and great at what they do. I highly recommend Two Men and a Truck. Worth every penny. Excellent company.

resp.text: We are so pleased to hear that you are happy with your experience. Thanks for choosing TWO MEN AND A TRUCK!

text: Called them and no one even returned our call. We used a different company that was fantastic.

resp.text: Hi Chandley, we do get back to all of our voicemails in a timely manner, and apologize for not connecting with you. Our main phone number is 251-316-5977 if you need to get in touch with us. We are happy that your move went well with another company.

Maybe the two guys sent to help were just too young and weak to be moving furniture. Maybe they will mature after working with the company a little longer!

resp.text: Hello Mr. Williams, We’re very sorry to learn of your recent experience and can certainly understand your frustrations. We have notified our team and encourage you to reach out directly at 251-316-5977.

text: I had the worst experience ever from these people they did not even half of their job it was ridiculous they were hours late and the office staff who you talk with over the phone are not professional they are very smart mouthed and really don’t try to resolve the issue i heard great things about them before booking and that is why i booked definitely do not recommend getting these people to move your things worst experience ever i wish it had a negative 1 star because that is what they would have gotten very unprofessional not reliable at all particularly Denice and crystal they were terrible

resp.text: Hi Miss Nyla, we do apologize for our late arrival, which is why we discounted our hourly rate for you and came out the following day to move your basketball hoop at no cost. We are sorry to hear that you aren't happy with this, but with a 97% satisfaction rate, I can guarantee that this isn't the norm. When we last spoke you were very happy, so if something changed between now and then, please give me a call: 251-316-5977 to discuss this further. Thank you!

name: Thatchic
text: Office staff seemed nice. Apparently they did not ask an important question. I was asked how many bedrooms and the number of items in each. I was also asked about living and dining room furniture. The guys showed up. One experienced, and one not. They started at one on, and by 3:30 they had only cleared one bedroom. My bedroom furniture is very heavy, and the guys were having a hard time. They informed management who brushed them off. I called with a concern about the time. I was told that my oak furniture was the problem. I was asked about quality of furniture on my initial call. This company moved this same furniture for me on a previous occasion. Anyway because of the time they had to leave some stuff behind and go to the drop off location. The supervisor eventually agreed to send help. Long after the mover told them of the problem. Initially I was told that I would have to cover this cost. Once the third guy arrived things went quick. He was experienced. My dresser was not able to be attached to my mirror because they left the screws for that at the location that I was leaving. So I have to find someone to do that. I live alone and don’t have a clue on how to do that. I did find the screws at the old address. I also found a complete mess left behind by the workers. At the new location, my living room and dining room furniture was just placed wherever. Three of my nightstands were left wrapped in plastic. I have plenty of pictures if needed. I do not fault the workers. When the worker informed the supervisor of the heavy oak bedroom furniture, assistance should have been immediately provided. Not later. They guys had to leave everything as such because of the time. I could not afford to pay $125 per hour for two additional hours. This is what was needed because of the wasted hours on the “heavy” furniture. Apparently they knew nothing about doing my move. It was a last minute surprise for them. They had just finished a job and was told that this job was only 12 items. Sounds like they were duped into it. Poor preparation on the supervisor’s behalf. Again I do not fault the movers. They asked for help at the onset and were ignored. They were extremely apologetic for the inconvenience. This is by far the worst experience I have ever had with a moving company. I will not recommend this company at all. I will also be contacting the corporate office. I feel like I was robbed. The workers deserved to be paid, because they did their best. They were exhausted. I feel like my cost should have been heavily discounted because the job is inadequate and incomplete. I have to pay out more money to get someone to help sort through the mess left behind. This move cost me $750!!!

resp.text: We're very sorry to learn of your recent move experience. With a 96% referral rate, we can assure you this is not the norm. We would be happy to speak with you further and encourage you to reach our team at 251-316-5977 so we may help.

name: Yogurty Cup
text: The fellas loaded and unloaded everything very quickly, and they disassembled and reassembled a bed for us too. We were on a three-story apartment, so the fact they handled it so well was very impressive. Worth the cost, which wasn't even that bad. Also, they were nice to our cat.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the opportunity to serve you!

name: paul bishop
text: I WOULD REFER TWO MEN AND TRUCK TO ANYONE MOVING!!!! The guys did a great job . I wish i could remember all three of there names but the one I do remember was Floyd, i'm sorry i forgot the other two guys. again great job!!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the opportunity to serve you!

name: Yancie Jackson
text: I've used these guys twice, and they are great! The movers they send are always so sweet and responsible with our belongings. They seem to take care when choosing who they hire as movers. The price is kind of steep, but it's comparable with other moving companies so it's nothing against them! I'd rather pay the rate and have the peace of mind knowing that all my things can be moved in a timely manner and taken care of properly in the process! A thoroughly enjoyable experience!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the opportunity to serve you!!

name: Resa Westbrook
text: Highly recommend Two Men and A Truck in Mobile, AL for moving! My move went smoothly from start to finish, and Alfred/driver was so good that o wrote his name down to request next time!

name: Ron Sivak
text: Overall tbe group did good work moving things, although the team lead (ironically) was the most careless with furniture and belongings. He did not follow customer instructions and tore the door off of a fairly fragile kid's chest that had to be thrown away. A foam QS bed mattress topper was ripped in half and essentially destroyed while removed from a bed - also due to not listening to directions from home owner.

resp.text: We appreciate the opportunity to serve you! We will use your feedback to help with training! Thank you again!

name: Danielle Haiden
text: The team was great. Thank you Daniel and Cooper. You'll unloaded a 15 ft uhaul, which took 8 plus hours to load, in about 2 hours. Can't go wrong with two men and a truck!

resp.text: Thank you for the opportunity to serve you!

name: Jeanne Hooker
text: On two separate moves moving furniture and antique furniture of which they were well informed they damaged two pieces and one reproduction piece.The management is totally rude and not willing to admit their negligence.They have attempted to repair a highboy and did not know what they were doing,used the wrong glue,made no attempt to properly prepare the restoration,.and left a mess on the legs.All they offered was a sad excuse for their lack of doing what was necessary.Now it will be a costly repair and the inconvenience of not being able to use it.The reproduction piece so badly damaged it will have to be rebuilt.How do I know this because my family were renowned collectors and dealers in fine antique furniture and  restoration was a process I well know! NEVER trust nor use this company if you have anything of value or real quality.What a low quality and the poorest customer relations!

resp.text: We are very sorry we were not able to live up to your expectations on your move. We wish you the best in the future.

name: Gypsy Spirit Underground
text: I hired them to move a business from a storage facility to a store front.  They completely underestimated the size of the truck needed and it ended up costing me more money cause they had to make 2 trips.  They measured and still sent the wrong size truck. After bringing  this to their attention they were to have a meeting and get back with me...NO RESPONSE, NO REFUND bad business.  Buyer beware..call someone else.

resp.text: Mrs. Ratajczack, first and foremost, I apologize that we didn't not live up to the standard of service you expected from us. I went back and reviewed your paperwork and contact logs and I wanted to hopefully clear up some items for you. All of our trucks are 26 feet in length. While we do have two "shorter" trucks in our fleet, it has to do with the height, not the floor space. We did go over on your original estimate by 30 minutes. While we always hope to hit the number spot on, we do sometimes miss and we thoroughly cover and explain to all customers how we bill on actual time used, not the estimate. This was covered in the pre-move email you received on 4/3/2018 and is also covered in item 1 on the Move Service contract that you and all of our customers sign before we begin a move.  Your move notes do say that our men "did a great job" but you were frustrated by the second trip that was made. I did not see however in those notes where a meeting was supposed to take place. If this somehow fell through the cracks, I sincerely apologize and will be happy to speak with you personally about the matter. You can reach me at the office @ 251-316-5977 or by email billy.stovall@twomen.com   While we never like to receive poor reviews, we will learn from it and hopefully improve our service to all customers. I appreciate you taking the time to leave it. Billy Stovall - Owner Two Men And A Truck Mobile, AL

name: Sarah McLeod
text:
3 years ago I used Two Men and a Truck and was very satisfied. Two men moved us from a house to an apartment across town, with a pit stop at a storage unit in between, in 2.5 hours. The guys were amazing. When I needed to move a couple weeks ago, due to my great experience previously, I chose to use this company again.

I don't know what has happened in the last 3 years, but I will never use this company again. They sent 3 guys this time, which would make you think it would take less time, right? No. I moved to an apartment that was 2 lights down from my then current apartment, and we again visited the storage unit, which is down the street from the new apartment. We basically went in a quarter mile triangle.  It took these 3 guys over 6 hours to move the contents of a one bedroom apartment and a small storage unit. They knocked off like 45 minutes for the break they took in the middle, so I paid for 5.5 hours total.

You may be thinking, how much stuff did she buy in that 3 year period?? The only difference between the first time and second time were 2 bookshelves, a chair, and a washer/dryer. With an extra person, they basically took 3 hours to move 2 bookshelves, a chair, and a washer/dryer.

I wanted to give these guys the benefit of the doubt, but after watching them visibly hem and haw at moving my stuff, visibly waste my time and money, I just can't. They mentioned that this company is under new ownership, which may be part of the problem. Maybe these guys get commission, I don't know. All I know is that I paid $925 to move a 1 bedroom apartment and a 5x8 storage unit a quarter mile down the road.

Do not use this company.

resp.text: Hello Sarah, we are so sorry your experience wasn't what you had expected and didn't live up to the high standards we have at Two Men And A Truck. We always try to exceed our customers expectations. I appreciate your review as we always try to use them to make our service better for everyone. Thank you for taking the time to do so. Best wishes in the future.

name: Nick Phillis
text:
ISSUE: Two Men and a Truck charged my card additional amount different from the final invoice WITHOUT permission. Management team did not always conduct professional business. See below:

We used Two Men and a Truck back in February. The crew did a decent job overall. They were hard working, the driver, Nate was exceptional. He had a great work ethic and was super professional and led the group.

My issue is with the management team. There was a discrepancy with the amount of time spent and the amount charged. The driver took off a little time from our final invoice because they spent an hour getting the electric bed upstairs. Essentially what he did was take off the $125 deposit from the quote. I felt like that was fair and I signed the final invoice. At that point I was happy with the move and we went on our merry way.

A few days later, I get an additional $125 charge from them on my credit card. Later that day, the operations manager who I believe his name is Joey, calls me to explain that he charged my card an additional $125 because I was quoted wrong on the final invoice. I explained to him that Nate took the $125 deposit off of the invoice because of the extra time it took them to move things when it shouldn’t have taken that much time. He explained to me that Nate didn’t have that authority and that I will have to pay the $125. I told Joey that I signed the final invoice giving them permission to charge my card for that final amount, in which he has no right to charge my card AGAIN without my permission. He then explained that he felt they have the right. If you give me a final invoice with an amount and I sign it, that is an agreement between the business and the client. A business has no right to change an agreement or amount after it has been signed by both parties. I got a call the next day from another manager to see how the move went. She was very nice and I explained the situation. I explained how I felt I was wronged in that my card was charged again without my permission, how Joey was unprofessional and does not conduct good business. She said that this information would be taken up the chain and people would be made aware. Ultimately nothing was done about it in the end. I just feel like it’s stealing when someone charges your card for an additional amount without permission. Just be aware.

resp.text: Hello Mr. Phillis, We're very sorry to learn of your recent move experience. With a 96% referral rate, we can assure you this is not the norm. We would be happy to speak with you further and encourage you to reach our team at 251-316-5977 so we may help.

name: Thatchic
text: Office staff seemed nice. Apparently they did not ask an important question. I was asked how many bedrooms and the number of items in each. I was also asked about living and dining room furniture. The guys showed up. One experienced, and one not. They started at one on, and by 3:30 they had only cleared one bedroom. My bedroom furniture is very heavy, and the guys were having a hard time. They informed management who brushed them off. I called with a concern about the time. I was told that my oak furniture was the problem. I was asked about quality of furniture on my initial call. This company moved this same furniture for me on a previous occasion. Anyway because of the time they had to leave some stuff behind and go to the drop off location. The supervisor eventually agreed to send help. Long after the mover told them of the problem. Initially I was told that I would have to cover this cost. Once the third guy arrived things went quick. He was experienced. My dresser was not able to be attached to my mirror because they left the screws for that at the location that I was leaving. So I have to find someone to do that. I live alone and don’t have a clue on how to do that. I did find the screws at the old address. I also found a complete mess left behind by the workers. At the new location, my living room and dining room furniture was just placed wherever. Three of my nightstands were left wrapped in plastic. I have plenty of pictures if needed. I do not fault the workers. When the worker informed the supervisor of the heavy oak bedroom furniture, assistance should have been immediately provided. Not later. They guys had to leave everything as such because of the time. I could not afford to pay $125 per hour for two additional hours. This is what was needed because of the wasted hours on the “heavy” furniture. Apparently they knew nothing about doing my move. It was a last minute surprise for them. They had just finished a job and was told that this job was only 12 items. Sounds like they were duped into it. Poor preparation on the supervisor’s behalf. Again I do not fault the movers. They asked for help at the onset and were ignored. They were extremely apologetic for the inconvenience. This is by far the worst experience I have ever had with a moving company. I will not recommend this company at all. I will also be contacting the corporate office. I feel like I was robbed. The workers deserved to be paid, because they did their best. They were exhausted. I feel like my cost should have been heavily discounted because the job is inadequate and incomplete. I have to pay out more money to get someone to help sort through the mess left behind. This move cost me $750!!!

resp.text: We're very sorry to learn of your recent move experience. With a 96% referral rate, we can assure you this is not the norm. We would be happy to speak with you further and encourage you to reach our team at 251-316-5977 so we may help.

text: Overall tbe group did good work moving things, although the team lead (ironically) was the most careless with furniture and belongings. A foam QS bed mattress topper was ripped in half and essentially destroyed while removed from a bed - also due to not listening to directions from home owner.

text: On two separate moves moving furniture and antique furniture of which they were well informed they damaged two pieces and one reproduction piece.The management is totally rude and not willing to admit their negligence.They have attempted to repair a highboy and did not know what they were doing,used the wrong glue,made no attempt to properly prepare the restoration,.and left a mess on the legs.All they offered was a sad excuse for their lack of doing what was necessary.Now it will be a costly repair and the inconvenience of not being able to use it.The reproduction piece so badly damaged it will have to be rebuilt.How do I know this because my family were renowned collectors and dealers in fine antique furniture and  restoration was a process I well know! NEVER trust nor use this company if you have anything of value or real quality.What a low quality and the poorest customer relations!

resp.text: We are very sorry we were not able to live up to your expectations on your move. We wish you the best in the future.

We are not the cheapest moving service, and never claim to be but we do provide great service for the rates we charge. name: Gypsy Spirit Underground
text: I hired them to move a business from a storage facility to a store front.  They completely underestimated the size of the truck needed and it ended up costing me more money cause they had to make 2 trips.  They measured and still sent the wrong size truck. After bringing  this to their attention they were to have a meeting and get back with me...NO RESPONSE, NO REFUND bad business.  Buyer beware..call someone else.

resp.text: Mrs. Ratajczack, first and foremost, I apologize that we didn't not live up to the standard of service you expected from us. I went back and reviewed your paperwork and contact logs and I wanted to hopefully clear up some items for you. All of our trucks are 26 feet in length. While we do have two "shorter" trucks in our fleet, it has to do with the height, not the floor space. We did go over on your original estimate by 30 minutes. While we always hope to hit the number spot on, we do sometimes miss and we thoroughly cover and explain to all customers how we bill on actual time used, not the estimate. This was covered in the pre-move email you received on 4/3/2018 and is also covered in item 1 on the Move Service contract that you and all of our customers sign before we begin a move.  Your move notes do say that our men "did a great job" but you were frustrated by the second trip that was made. I did not see however in those notes where a meeting was supposed to take place. If this somehow fell through the cracks, I sincerely apologize and will be happy to speak with you personally about the matter. You can reach me at the office @ 251-316-5977 or by email billy.stovall@twomen.com   While we never like to receive poor reviews, we will learn from it and hopefully improve our service to all customers. I appreciate you taking the time to leave it. Billy Stovall - Owner Two Men And A Truck Mobile, AL

text: The movers were very polite and on time. However, the original estimate provided as 6.5 hours but ended up being a 2 day job at a much higher cost. Furthermore, items/boxes were unloaded in garage in a haphazard way. Not stacked against wall, just thrown in the middle. I, just having both hips replaced had to move every box to make a walk space. I would be hesitant to recommend this company after this experience.

resp.text: Good morning Mrs. Smith.  We do appreciate all feedback but our records indicate that we did not perform your move. Records do however show that we gave you an estimate for a move on 3/22/17 but you never booked with us. Please contact our Office Manager, Casey, at 251-316-5977 and hopefully we can point you in the right direction. Thank you!

name: Sarah McLeod
text:
3 years ago I used Two Men and a Truck and was very satisfied. Two men moved us from a house to an apartment across town, with a pit stop at a storage unit in between, in 2.5 hours. The guys were amazing. When I needed to move a couple weeks ago, due to my great experience previously, I chose to use this company again.

I don't know what has happened in the last 3 years, but I will never use this company again. They sent 3 guys this time, which would make you think it would take less time, right? No. I moved to an apartment that was 2 lights down from my then current apartment, and we again visited the storage unit, which is down the street from the new apartment. We basically went in a quarter mile triangle.  It took these 3 guys over 6 hours to move the contents of a one bedroom apartment and a small storage unit. They knocked off like 45 minutes for the break they took in the middle, so I paid for 5.5 hours total.

You may be thinking, how much stuff did she buy in that 3 year period?? The only difference between the first time and second time were 2 bookshelves, a chair, and a washer/dryer. With an extra person, they basically took 3 hours to move 2 bookshelves, a chair, and a washer/dryer.

I wanted to give these guys the benefit of the doubt, but after watching them visibly hem and haw at moving my stuff, visibly waste my time and money, I just can't. They mentioned that this company is under new ownership, which may be part of the problem. Maybe these guys get commission, I don't know. All I know is that I paid $925 to move a 1 bedroom apartment and a 5x8 storage unit a quarter mile down the road.

Do not use this company.

resp.text: Hello Sarah, we are so sorry your experience wasn't what you had expected and didn't live up to the high standards we have at Two Men And A Truck. We always try to exceed our customers expectations. I appreciate your review as we always try to use them to make our service better for everyone. Thank you for taking the time to do so. Best wishes in the future.

name: Hope Downey
text:
The move went well. The young men were very polite! However, they knew nothing about packing breakables for a move!! We had a large amount of broken items ranging from pictures, glass doors on furniture, antique crystal, dishes, etc. it has been 6 months and we have not received compensation for all our damaged items. I think they are hoping we would forget about most of the things!! Of course, after not hearing from them this last time for 5 weeks, they simply said, "we were waiting for YOU to call back!"
For this reason I would not recommend them!!!
Especially if you are moving valuables!!!

resp.text: Mrs Downey, I apologize for the lack of communication on your damages. I can assure you we never just "hope" someone forgets. I am the owner and will look at your case personally and see if I can get to the bottom of the delay. I do thank you for your business and hope we can get you squared away soon.

name: Robert Harding
text: Avoid at all costs. We contracted them to move us 5 hours away. A manager came out and gave me a quote, which was reasonable. On the day of the move, only half of out belongings would fit in the trucks and the manager tried to exhort considerably more money out of me to move the other half. Classic bait and switch. My family ended up renting a U-Haul to get some of our stuff to the new house. We have since made multiple trips in a van and still don't have all our things. Avoid this poor excuse for a company. I will never consider 2 Men and a Truck ever again, and nor should you.

resp.text: Hello Robert. I'm so sorry your experience with Two Men And A Truck was a negative one. The Mobile franchise is under new ownership as of August 5th 2016 and is diligently working to make this location one of the best in the system. Thank you for your feedback!

Again, I do apologize for your experience. That is not typical for us as a company.

text:
This was a pack and move. First red flag was the pack estimate almost doubling after the GM made his onsite visit before the pack. I expressed my concerns with that. Wife and I ended up packing 80% of it. It was determined one truck was enough for the move. It wasnt. My wife and I had to make mutiple trips (4 or 5) to get everything that was left. I expressed I wasnt happy and wanted a partial refund ($350 out of a total $2700 bill). GM called me and apologized and said he would call me back in 24 hours. That was about 2 months ago. Folks in the office were nice. Guys who showed up to pack our stuff were nice and guys moving us were nice. None of our stuff was damaged.

Update: the issue has been resolved by Casey.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the opportunity to serve you and make things right!

Called several but it was only one that stepped up to bail my wife and I out of a night mare. My wife had just lost her mother and her father past five months prior. Kind, considerate, and professional. I promise you you'll not be able to compare Lackey's teams to any because they've proven to me there's none better. Lackey's moved two large estates for us and saved our Hinds. Thanks Guys y'all are the best, hands down!! Rob & Beth Cutrer of West Point, MS

name: L M Sparks
text: Many thanks to Crocker Moving Services for making the first part of my move easy! I am moving belongings into storage until my new home is available. Katrina did a great job taking care of me through storage location and move date changes! On the day of the move Justin and William called about 30 mins before arrival and arrived on time. After a quick tour of what was to be moved, they got straight to work and had me loaded in less than and hour. At the storage unit, they unloaded my belongings with room to spare. Outstanding job. Fast. Courteous. And very careful with my belongings. Second part of my move is in two weeks and I have no doubts it will go just as smooth! Thank you again Crocker Moving Services and especially Katrina, Justin and William!!!!

name: Jerry Overman
text: I've used Crocker moving services twice. Eric and his team show up, get the job done in a professional manner and treat your property like it' s theirs. I highly recommend them and will use them again if the need arises.

name: Daniel Lowe
text:
Moving is a stressful experience and there are a lot of options out there. I’d heard Crocker advertised on the Leland Live radio show and had a friend who had used them. Could not recommend them more. From the call to schedule to the day-of experience everything was top notch and far more than I really expected. When you call to schedule they will ask a lot of specifics which is designed to have the right size truck. Ours was dead on.

I have to talk about the crew I had: Cam, Elton and Jamal. These guys acted like they were moving their own mother’s things. They were friendly, careful, professional and went above and beyond in everything they did. The entire process took much less time than I had planned on based on how hard they worked and that left me the rest of the day to get settled into our new home. This was the first time I’d ever hired movers and I didn’t know what to expect going into this process based on some stories I’ve heard.

I hope this move is the last one I make for a long time, but if I ever move again Crocker will be the first call I make.

name: Patrick Grant
text: Elton and Tyrone helped us with an in home move to prepare for wood floor refinishing. They were extremely professional and completed the job on time. They took great care with our furniture. We will definitely use Crocker in the future.

name: Garry Taylor
text: Elton, Cam, and Chris did a fantastic job packing our POD.  They were on time, treated our furniture like their own, worked as a team to maximize space, and worked smart and hard, a rare combination these days.  I would recommend Crocker Moving to anyone who needs a helping hand moving, packing, storage, whatever...a professional organization with hard working professional young men who impressed me, and that’s not an easy thing to do- Thank you Crocker Moving and Storage!

name: Rachel Ryan
text:
Fantastic experience. Movers Antwon and Jamaal arrived exactly on time and were pleasant, polite, and helpful—an all-around pleasure. They loaded everything into the truck very quickly AND with extreme care, meaning they were in and out in much less time than originally estimated, which was great for many reasons—most of all, because the less time it took, the more money we saved on the hourly moving fee!

Thanks, Antwon and Jamaal! Because of your good work and great attitude, I would absolutely use Crocker Moving Services again, whether for another international move or a domestic/local one!

You both are assets to the company and I hope your bosses recognize your great work, too! :)

name: Kim Pearson
text: I would highly recommend. They were quick and efficient. Did a great job moving a large heavy piece of furniture from one floor to a lower floor. Perfect gentlemen the entire time they were at my house.

name: Bill Stewart
text:
Every move of personal goods from home to home carries its own unique problems and concerns; mine was no different.  What I found was a company that partnered with me for success and then delivered.  Katrina worked closely with me on schedule and expectations at the front end and closure of the move at the end.  Mike and Johnny managed the loading and loading of my household goods - efficient, positive, problem solving and safe handling. I had no damage; none.

Would I use them again; yes.  Do I recommend them for your moving needs; absolutely.

name: Brandon Vanslambroucc 8ck
text:
THIS COMPANY IS EXPENSIVE, SLOW AND NOT PUNCTUAL!!!!!!!   In researching this company I heard nothing but sterling reviews about how affordable and quick they were. 2.5 HOURS LATE, TOOK 5 1/2 HOURS FOR A SIMPLE JOB WHILE BEING PAID BY THE HOUR, COMPANY IS NOT RESPONSIVE TO COMPLAINTS.  Prepare to be shocked when you receive a massive bill like  did for $700+ to move some items down the street.

My mother- in-law was moving less than a mile down the street. I had all of her stuff gift wrapped, packed, and ready to be moved. I even put all of it in the garage. No stairs, narrow hallways, or doors...easy right?

The problems start when they finally arrive 2.5 hours later than the given time. Which is annoying because she could have left work 45 min early instead of taking a vacation day to wait on them.

They finally arrive and begin work. Nearly 5-1/2 hours later they leave. I have no complaint about the work except that it could not all get done due the glacier pace they maintained at $115.00 per hour.

I gave Crocker a call to work this out. While they were understanding, they were unwilling to do anything. Don't be fooled by the Leland Live Talk 99.5 ads or their curated google reviews.

text: Had an excellent speedy moving day plus our excellent movers Elton and Tre were MORE than patient, kind and accommodating! Thanks for everything👍

name: Cody B
text: Cannot recommend. Arrived hours late. Would not have shown up if I had not called an hour after they were scheduled to start. When I initially scheduled and made payment in advance, I asked for confirmation that the movers would have furniture and appliance dollies, as is posted on their online service description. I was told that was accurate. When the movers finally arrived, they did not have either furniture or appliance movers, and it was apparent that they had just been assigned the work an hour or so beforehand when I had called for an ETA after the no show. We had a 1,000 square foot, 2 bedroom apartment to load and unload at a house 10 minutes away. We used a 26 foot U-haul truck for the move and only filled it 75% full (packed haphazardly). One of the two small, young men had only been on the job for a few days, and he could not load the larger appliances and furniture. I had to move those items together with the other young man to get them loaded and unloaded. We paid $75 an hour, plus fees. And because of the lack of tools, experience and muscle, the job took 8 hours. I called the company while the job was still ongoing, and was given a 1.5 hour discount (then charged twice for a one-time "travel fee"). I've moved numerous times in the past when I was on active duty in the Marine Corps, and had three times as much stuff loaded in half the time. What a stressful, expensive nightmare. Packing and moving your whole life is hard enough without enduring an experience such as this one. 1 star service, plus 1 reluctant star for the small discount.

name: Alicia Ellis
text: Great customer service and the movers were professional and friendly. They packed quickly and didn't break anything.

name: Stephenie Higgins
text: I had a wonderful experience with Precise Movers! I highly recommend them!

name: Ashley Richardson
text: Used This Side Up Moving of Birmingham to move from an apartment to new home. Great experience overall from quotes, scheduling, to the actual move. Was quoted about 4 hours but could be more since apartment = slow elevator. Ended up being about 5 hours. The movers were hard working and weren’t standing around. Extremely polite and friendly. Would recommend and would use again in the future. Thanks!

name: jimmyoregano1
text:
Personable young men; Ethan, Bobby, and tall guy Nate.
Very responsive and helpful. Would definitely recommend.

name: ira bornstein
text:
*** EDIT ***
After my initial review, the company came out to my home to make corrections where appropriate.  I am pleased with their response.

*** Original Review ***
Unfortunately, we did not have an overall positive experience with This side up.  The good parts were that they were all very polite, and their main mover Garret was a hard worker and smart mover.  The issues were;
1.) Their move quote was for 7/30 which is when we wanted to move.  When we agreed to book it (less than 24-hours later), suddenly their first availability wasn't until 8/6...frustrating, but we could be flexible
2.) With This side up, the customer pays for all travel time to our home, and from the dropoff - We invested $110 in paying them to come and go to their own office.  That's part of the contract, just something that all consumers should be aware of, as it's different among all companies
3.) The biggest issue was the errors that they made, and the money their mistakes cost us;
- They spent 20 minutes extra trying to figure out how to put the dresser mirror back on, asking us what we did with the screws/bolts.  Since they dismantled the dresser/mirror, they had what they needed the whole time
- They took apart a perfectly stable bed, and somehow lost those bolts as well.  As such, they cost us extra time and money and then just arranged the bed parts, not telling us that the bed would collapse when we went to bed...Bad treatment of a customer.

We expected the inevitable small matters (furniture scuffs, torn screen, etc.) as those are a part of any move.  That said, we've moved many times and this was the most disappointing crew yet; a real pro in Garret, and a couple of pure rookies who cost us money, and frustration.  I did give the company a chance to respond, but did not hear back after they got paid.

name: Barbara Walker
text: This was the absolute worst experience I have ever had moving.  Please don’t use this company. You will regret it if you do. I have so much stuff that was damaged. Not put back together properly and not put in the right place.

name: Dale Bartsch
text: I just moved from Boaz , AL to Palm Bay, FL. This has been the greatest moving experience I have ever had! Starting with Kristy, who spent an endless amount of time prepping everything over the phone & calming my nerves! The movers Dee & Garret were absolutely phenomenal! I also had Ty help out on the load in Boaz, who was also great. But, Dee & Garret were the most prompt, professional, courteous, & efficient movers I could ever ask for! They also did so much to calm my anxiety! I highly recommend this company!

name: R Burgess
text: Just want to let you know how pleased we are with your company, which we have experienced through three of your fine employees. Chelsea, our estimator was professional, friendly, and downright engaging over the phone. We paid what she quoted, period. Kevin and Alec, our movers, were also professional, friendly, and obviously well-trained experienced movers. They got the job done in a timely matter, and persevered in what turned out to be a challenging job. I would not hesitate to recommend your company to move furniture, or mountains!

name: Tiny Smith
text: Alex and crew.... on time, cautious with valuable items and worked like a fleet of Energizer Bunnies 🐰

name: Geneva Payne
text: These guys are wonderful! We have moved a few times over the years, these guys are friendly, punctual, efficient, careful. Everything you want in movers of your possessions. They are also a great price for all if this, they are upfront about costs and clear every step of the way. We will be using them again! I highly recommend them!

name: Callie Church
text: I used them 3 times, they kept in contact the day of, showed up on time and worked very efficiently!  Spooner and Juan did an amazing job of packing up our trailer in Huntsville and were very friendly!

name: Aubrey Jones Vosnick
text: Fantastic group!  On time did more than expected. Super nice. The "G" guys were fantastic!

name: Beverly Linam
text: These guys are fabulous and professional. They have handled my last 3 moves. I highly recommend this company.

name: No Mad's
text:
My wife and I relocated for work from Birmingham to Mobile . The movers showed up Garette & Eric they where very, very professional, fast and efficient . They completed the entire house loading up and delivery under targeted hours. The had a positive attitude through the entire process. I would recommend them to all my colleagues relocating, friends and family. We will use them for our next relocation without a second thought. My wife and I couldn’t be more satisfied !!! Garette & Eric rock. Thanks,
Happy movers!!

name: Chelsea Quintela
text: I highly recommend these guys! I was nervous to hire a moving company for the first time, but great experience! Very professional and honest!

name: Christina Carmona
text: Garrett and Marquese were my movers and they did a wonderful job! They were on time, fast, efficient and very professional. I would say from start to finish my experience with This Side Up in BHM was positive. Britney was really easy and pleasant to work with while booking the move.  But the guys were really impressive!

name: Tamarra Clark
text: Good trustworthy guys. Very careful and strong. Would recommend to anyone!

name: Evan Broome
text: Great company, Garrett personally made sure all of our needs were met was highly professional and helped make our move as smooth as possible. Highly recommend these guys.

name: Jason Howell
text: We hired this so-called company to move a hot tub 50 feet from a one step up back porch to a trailer in the front yard. They were supposed to have 4 men minimum but they only had 3 employees at the time. Well after I drove 50 miles one way, with a trailer I had to borrow from one of my friends, theybshow up with 2 guys and no equipment whatsoever except the little shoulder strap . They said the 3rd guy overslept and was running late. They look at the tub, think it's too heavy looking and when they removed the cover there were several wood roaches, where there was a tiny bit of water in the seats. We're in a pretty bad drought and the tub hasn't been used in 2 years so they are used to getting water there. The 2 guys came out and said they had to run back to the shop real quick and grab something  The office lady called the widow woman we are trying to help get rid of the tub so she can have her deck redone, and said it had a lot of water in it and it was infested with roaches, both of which are absolutely outright lies and they would credit back here credit card! Which they had charged $300 just to move it 50 feet by the way! Don't ever do business with this joke of a company! Ever!

resp.text: Hey Jason, thank you for the feedback. I'm sorry that we don't move hottubs that are housing roaches and standing water. We do ask for all hottubs to be cleaned and dried before moving. Our team lead did send the office a video of the roaches and at that point we decided to step away from the job.  We obviously hated to lose the money for the job after driving all that way and making you unhappy in the process. At the end of the day its a safety and sanitation issue and didn't feel comfortable moving forward with the job.

name: Stephanie Pentecost
text: A great company that really knows what they are doing! Honest & trustworthy! Best moving company in Birmingham!!

name: Bridget Hutto
text: Great job!! I would highly recommend these guys!! They helped me move my furniture and they were very polite and hard workers! Would definitely use them again if needed!!

resp.text: Thanks and God Bless

name: McLean Wilhite
text: We had a huge truck to unload and the guys showed up ready to work! I was shocked when they finished it all in five hours… we were prepared to be there all night.

name: Tia Dubose
text: They were quick, efficient, and polite. Even handled small items with care.

resp.text: Thanks and God Bless

name: AZ Clark
text: I called Buddy Lee's Shipping and Transport, and they were very professional.  Micah and Nick were energetic and on time.  They had on masks which made my family feel safe during this pandemic.  They made sure all of our household goods and furniture were protected.  I love that they wrapped our furniture which made us trust their services.  They also looked very nice in their uniform shirts.  They showed great manners and were very polite and respectful.  I was very pleased to see young men so well mannered.  I plan on referring this company to coworkers at my job.  I also have many military friends who move frequently.  I will definitely refer them to Buddy Lee's for moving and transport services.  They were also kind enough to take the items we no longer wanted to dumpsters.  My family was very impressed with this crew.  Our past experiences with other moving companies were not so pleasant.  I really appreciate finding young men so willing to serve families.  I want to thank Buddy Lee's Shipping and Transport for a marvelous moving experience.  I also love their theme, "No Move Too Small For Us".  I will certainly use their services again.

resp.text: Thanks and God Bless

name: Alexandra Lepley
text: I highly recommend Buddy Lees! They loaded up my truck for a long trip home so well. Happy to report nothing broken and they were very nice guys!! The owner even stopped by to make sure everything was good and he is extremely nice.

resp.text: Thanks Ms. Lepley

text: The men did an excellent job assisting me with my move to Tuscaloosa. Definitely one of the best in the business. Will most definitely choose them again.

resp.text: Thanks God Bless

name: william whitaker

name: JaMikal M
text: Penske trucks are governed at 65mph...which is understandable. But the acceleration of the truck was horrible on the 26ft box truck we got. Yes it was well weighted but I shouldn't be flooring and still can't get over 25mph when getting on the highway. Even on the highway, unless going down a slight hill it was almost impossible to get to 65mph. And going up hill the motor was dying. Alabama has some steep hills and the truck was barely making it. The mph were dropping while going up the hill. Please Penske, get trucks with a stronger motor! This is a safety hazard!

resp.text: Hello, thank you for taking the time out to review our location. We appreciate the feedback on how we may be able to better our services. If you would like to discuss this further, we can be reached at 1(800)-467-3675.

name: Michael Paradis
text:
Penske has become a favorite for my family for the past two years and will remain our favorite truck rental company for the foreseeable future.  The initial contact, rental rates, in trip service and the drop off makes the customer feel appreciated because of services and courteous employees. I have used Penske on 5 separate times to affect my family's staged moves that saved me thousands of dollars.
I tip my hat to the company. Military families should call Penske first. You are VERY MUCH appreciated for your service to country Penske's appreciation keeps $$$ in your pocket.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave this review, Michael. We appreciate your feedback. Penske would be happy to help you with any moving needs in the future. You can reach us at 1(800)467-3675

Joe

name: Jan Banks
text: We moved from TN to FL a few weeks ago, and with U-Pack's excellent customer service and promises kept they helped to bring down the temperature of moving a household across states. We highly recommend their services for peace of mind with on-time, friendly and professional employees!

name: Laurie Laxton
text: Unbelievably awesome. Moving across states was so stressful. From the time of booking to the time of arranging pick up of the 27 foot trailer at the other end this company was too notch. Every person I dealt with was most professional and helpful. Thank you for being the smoothest part of this move.

name: Michael Scott
text: We were on a tight time table for our move and got a lot of bang for our buck with U-Pack.  Delivered to pack when they said they would and picked up & delivered to our new house.  Everyone I spoke to was professional, courteous and went out of their way to help!

name: Paige Jordan
text: U-pack offered the BEST price for moving out of state compared to other companies. The moving cube was delivered, picked up, and dropped off on time, my items delivered safely! The customer service reps were also very friendly and helpful. However, the information given from each person was inconsistent... The first person I spoke with said that there would be a deposit. After the cube was picked up, I asked when the deposit would be charged and they said that there was no deposit, that my card would be charged during transit. My card wasn't charged during transit, so I called again, and they finally sent a link for me to pay. I actually found it comical that I had to call them to pay instead of them calling me to get my money LOL. Despite the miscommunication, I would definitely use this service again and will recommend them.

name: The Party Princess
text: I have zero complaints about our experience with UPACK. They were GREAT! everyone I talked to was so beyond helpful and nice whether it was about scheduling, tracking, or answering my basic questions. All customer service reps were knowledgeable and went above and beyond. I mainly talked to the Stockton CA office and Decatur AL office and I had great help from them both. UPACK made our across the country move stress free, got our stuff there early, and we were able to track the truck the whole time. THANK YOU!! I already am scheduling my parent's move with you for them because I am confident in your services.

name: Alexa Henderson
text: My husband and I used them to move across the country and are extremely pleased. Not only were they on time, but their customer service was excellent! I never had to wait on hold to get help, and everyone I talked to was extremely friendly and helpful. I even accidentally put in our wrong destination address and was panicking, but they responded to my email within an hour assuring me they had taken care of it. Great price for such a high quality service!

name: Howard Swims
text: This was a great way to move household items cross country without having to use an expensive moving service or renting a truck to drive.  Very friendly staff and the pod arrived to our destination (2400 miles away) within a week.  We would definitely use this again if needed.

name: Evyonne Taylor
text: Very helpful and friendly people work here. Highly recommend their services.

name: beau waldron
text: Stop your search here! Bolt Movers is by far the most professional moving company I have come across. From the contact from the office on the phone to the moving team coming to my home, there was impeccable communication and professionalism. Baylor and Christian were kind, professional, and careful with our belongings. Working through the hot day with a smile on their face. They even seemed HAPPY to rearrange items in our new home when we needed them moved to another room. My wife and I will not move with anyone else!

name: Erica DeSpain
text: We hired BOLT Movers to move us a few miles across town and our experience was near perfect. The movers were professional, skilled, and always on time. The pricing was clear, and though it was a bit more than some competitors, we felt that we absolutely received better service than we would have with any competitors. TJ was the lead and he was phenomenal. We will strongly recommend BOLT to our family and friends. In a real estate climate that's ever-changing, flexibility was key and BOLT was there for us. Thank you Bolt! -Erica

text: I would highly recommend Bolt movers to anyone needing to move locally.  Arrival was slightly earlier than expected with a phone call to confirm my apartment / building location.  TJ and Ian were very professional, honest, and friendly, walking through each room to make sure nothing was missed while quickly planning out the best way to load their moving truck.  They were quick to ask questions and make sure things were moved and positioned in the correct place.  Great work on accomplishing the move much faster than expected!

text: Bolt movers was lifesaving to us at the end of a very long, hard day! Our movers Baylor, Conner, and Ian did an exceptional job. They worked efficiently and with a kind demeanor, even after being given a job that was more than they were initially assigned. Would recommend this company and their excellent movers to everyone! We hope these guys get the recognition they deserve. Even our parents raved about how great they were!

text: My wife and I just used them on a short local move and they guys were prompt & professional. Cost was in line.  I would highly recommend them!
