They moved my piano a few inches several times after they were done assembling it to get it in the exact right position I wanted. I’m very grateful to Tucker and Jenkins. They constantly asked me with a positive attitude what else they could do to help me. I will keep hiring Move Daddy in the future.

name: Donna Porter
text: I just want to commend Move Daddy for a fantastic move. I recently downsized into a smaller space which meant two-stops including transferring items into a storage unit and a home. The movers did an excellent job and did it in record time and with great care. I wasn't sure my items would fit in the storage once I saw it but the guys assured me it would work and it did with space to spare. I couldn't be happier! Thank you Christian, Isaac and Zack. I'll definitely be using you again for future moves.

name: Richard Simmons
text: Logan and Conrad were exceptional.  Punctual, efficient and friendly.  I will definitely hire MoveDaddy again.

name: Kristopher Mason
text: Start to finish, I've yet to have a better moving experience than with MoveDaddy. Getting a rate quote from and booking the move with Jered was simple. Mark and Izaak arrived shortly prior to our arranged meet time, and after walking them through the apartment, they got to work. By the time I'd finished breaking down a large bed, they'd already loaded everything else! At the new home, the unload was just as fast, with the occasional stop only to see where I wanted specific items placed. Since I wasn't breaking down a bed this time, I was able to see that although they'd loaded the truck quickly, my items had been packed and secured into the truck with care, and were unloaded with the same amount of care. These guys are good!

name: jean santamaria
text: Fantastic staff, Jared is one of the best in the business displaying punctuality and professional quality to the upmost knowledge. Highly recommend Birmingham  to use movedaddy!

name: Ryan Alexander
text: Had a last minute move and these guys were very accommodating with my schedule. Jenkins and Nick worked twice as fast and hard as any other movers I’ve ever used. Even assembling two bed frames and installing our washer/dryer. I don’t know where they find these guys but you would’ve never thought it was their second move of the day in 100 degree heat and humidity. Will 100% use again. Did in 6 hours what it took “Two Men and a Truck” to do in 13 for half the price.

name: raymondcolley
text: I sold my home in Alabama and needed to move and store my goods until I could find a home in Tennessee. My PODS sit in their facility for 6 months until I purchased my new home. name: Bette Cobb
text:
A zero is too high for this company.  My personal things were put in two storage containers 6 years ago by a business that cleaned up our water damaged house.  Five years ago that business we got to do the clean up went out of business and the two containers were taken out of our yard with my belongings and without notice.  I am not allowed to have access to them because I don't have the pin # to the account. Five years ago, we got no help from the local business or main company.  We tried to get everything take care of then and couldn't get in touch with the business that worked originally with us and PODS would only talk to the original business that was no longer in existence.
So, skip to a week ago I get a letter that informs me of the amount that is owed on the two pods since 2016 and will be put up for auction at the end of the month.  I am a third party and have tried to work with this company - I called and asked about the letter and was told it was a mistake and I shouldn't have gotten it.  Yet, six years later I am still not allowed to get my families' things that are still in the storage units.  So, I was told that nothing could be done and my things would be sold at an auction on 29th of this month.  So, if I paid the $26,692 that was owed by the other company that contracted with Pods originally, could I get my things with no PIN #?  I would just like some help and it seems like no one cares at this company.  There needs to be some way to work this out.  I would like to try and get some help with this because it was not my fault the other business did not pay - but you would think it is.

resp.text: We can understand how you're feeling and would like to research this further, Bette. Can you please email socialmedia@pods.com with the customer ID number or any additional information to help locate the order.

name: Teshika Holmes
text: I’m no longer pleased with this service. I have had to contact customer service and they are unprofessional with long hold times, they have messed my account up and constantly charging my credit card after already paying hundreds of dollars already.  Then their collections department have contacted me was unprofessional. I’m to the point where I would like to cancel everything and go with another moving company. Nothing has gone smooth with this company. I’m on a crunch already with an apartment I have to be moved out of already. Each day I call this company between customer service and billing nothing gets straightened out ever! Will never recommend or use this service again!!!

resp.text: We certainly don’t like to see this, Teshika. If you’d like to chat, please email socialmedia@pods.com with your customer ID and additional details.

name: Marcus Davis
text:
My wife and I were extremely satisfied and happy with the service we recieved from Liberty Moving. We utilized their services twice during our transition into our new home and their service with nothing short of outstanding.

On 5/27/2020, we had a heavily packed 10 x 15 storage with extremely heavy plastic bins. We also had bins that were color coded and separated based on fragility. Not only did Eric and Roy show up at a punctual time, they were extemely fast at loading the truck and being extremely careful with our fragile things. They were very professional and polite throughout the enitre process. Unloading the truck was even faster. Eric and Roy were very hardworking and made sure our moving process was as painless as possible. I will definitely use this company for any future moves and definitely refer every person moving to this company.

On 6/2/2020, my wife and I used Liberty Moving to help us move our two bedroom apartment to our new home. This job was very challenging as we stayed on the sixth floor of our apartment and the elevator for that building was broken down. Going up and down the stairs, multiple times. at the apartment is a very winded task, let alone having to carry heavy furniture. I was astonished to find out the crew that Liberty Moving sent out to our home got it done in such a quick manner. Gage, Connor, Oliver, and Barret were simply amazing and efficient. These gentleman made quick work of moving our entire two bedroom apartment onto the truck s despite going up and down so many stairs. They worked extremely hard and I know that all of these gentlemen were very tired once they finished. They truly exemplify going above and beyond. The same can be said about Eric and Roy. I repeat myself that I highly, highly, highly recommend this company to anybody.

Not only is this company very professional, but they will move very quickly and make sure you are taken care of. So many positive things about this company.

resp.text: Marcus thank you for allowing us the opportunity! I assure you it was our pleasure!

name: Victoria Hartley
text: It appears my previous review was deleted. Just speaks to the fact that the business will not take ownership of the lack of quality in services provided. I have attached photos to show the  reasons for my one star review and will continue to post to inform the community not to utilize this moving company.

resp.text:
Victoria,
Thank you for your review. Your previous review from April 2018 when we moved you must have not been submitted because we cannot remove reviews. We even deal with a lot of fake reviews submitted from false accounts from other moving companies. However,
I will look into this job done nearly 2 years ago to see if we provided packing material or if that was something you were supposed to do and I will get back to you after the assessment. Also if you’ll do a little research unloading is always faster than packing and loading (and padding) if that makes sense. A few minutes ago I just went back and looked and noticed in your pictures we do not provide boxes from Metro Mini storage so it seems these boxes were packed by you. It would have been best for you to wrap these items in packing paper before they were moved

text: My hubby and I truly enjoyed the help of Liberty Moving Company. Thanks again! I will definetly be recommending this company.

text: Responsible and reliable service during a stressful time. I appreciate the professionalism from start to finish. I would highly recommend!!

name: Dawn Sherman
text: I hired Liberty for a move from Alabama to Massachusetts. It was the worst experience. The movers showed up a day and a half late and took 7 hours to load furniture from my apartment. The worst part was that 3 days later as I was driving to Massachusetts, I received a call that the driver of the moving truck was arrested for assault and the truck with my items was being impounded. It turns out the driver was a convicted felon, unbeknownst to me. It took me more than a week and dozens of phone calls, emails and affidavits to get my items released. Tyler did nothing to help me. I then had to hire a new moving company to drive from Massachusetts to Baltimore to retrieve my belongings because Liberty abandoned them there. When the new movers arrived in Baltimore, they opened the truck to find many pieces of my furniture were destroyed and others were badly scratched and dented. I had thousands of dollars of damage to my belongings. Since I had paid Tyler in full for a move that was a disaster and was never completed, I asked him for my money back. He has refused multiple times. Be careful if you are considering hiring this company. I was scammed and I don't want anyone to go through what I did. I have proof of these events as well - the signed ladling form from Liberty, emails from Tyler (who posed as "James" to me on the phone), a copy of the driver's arrest record from the police, a picture of one of the movers in a Liberty T-shirt, my bank statement showing that payment was made to Liberty Moving, and more. Tyler claims the movers I had did not work for him directly but everything proves otherwise. The bottom line, it was a Tyler who took my money and who now won't stand behind this mess. I'm out thousands of dollars and he doesn't care. Please be careful.

name: Dawn Cook
text: Reliable, respectable and affordable!  Need I say more! Thank you Liberty for making my moving experience smooth!

resp.text: Thank you Dawn! We appreciate you!

name: Clothing Dist
text: We hired Liberty Moving and Storage to move us from Vestavia to Mountain Brook. We had already moved into the house and were living in it, but the majority of our belongings were still in storage. After the move was over and all of the employees were outside (or so we thought), I went upstairs to get my checkbook and I caught one of the employees in my closet/dressing room area.The hair stood up on the back of my neck. I immediately knew something was wrong, I asked him what he was doing there and he told me he brought up one last box, and then he headed downstairs. I immediately went to my jewelry drawer which was in a separate closet that had been locked all day. There is a lot more detail that I could go into about when and why I unlocked that part of the closet, but it’s too much detail to go into here. What I want people to know is that I immediately opened my jewelry drawer and my wedding ring was gone. I yelled downstairs for Chris and my husband to come upstairs and I explained what I witnessed. Chris called the thief into the house and asked him if he took my ring and he denied it. Go figure. Chris said something like, “well he says he didn’t take your ring”. The next day, we also realized that my husbands wedding band had been stolen as well. Tyler and Chris (owners) refused to file an insurance claim with their insurance comoany to pay for the replacement of our wedding rings. “Bonded and insured”.... by the way, that means nothing!  We were basically told to handle it with our own insurance company. And because my appraisal was old, we have never been made whole. They still owe us thousands of dollars. Over $10K. At first Tyler acted as if he wanted to help resolve this, but a couple of days after the fact, it was, deny, deny, deny. When Tyler and Chris were later asked in front of a judge if they did background checks  on their employees, the answer was, no. They were also asked if they fired the employee. We were in disbelief at their answer, and so was the judge who ruled in our favor that we didn't have to pay them for the move. The thief failed to show up for his interview with the police detective. The DA has had a warrant out for the ring thief’s arrest for several months now. He was finally arrested and is out on bond. All I want is my ring back. Can you steal anything more personal? I still hold out hope that it will be found and returned to me. The employee they employed is a predator, and they allowed him into their clients homes. A simple google search of his name allowed me to pull up his arrest records on my home computer. The thief groomed me all day as he set me up for that theft. These guys seem like the nicest guys in the world, Please don’t be fooled!

name: Kat Owens
text:
We moved over a year ago and I left a review on Facebook but looks like they may have deleted their page, so I’ll leave one here. There were so many bad reviews on their Facebook page and one of them was mine. The movers moved so slowly, unless the boss showed up. A lot of standing around. A couple guys got in a fight in my front yard and 1 driver took off with one moving van. They sent another guy but I paid for the time of travel so no discount for the time I was down a mover. I was charged for things they said I wouldn’t be charged for. Lunch took over an hour yet I only had an hour Credit for lunch. They estimated a certain amount and it took at least 3 times that thus 3 times the cost. This is after they walked through the house and knew exactly what was happening. We had those funds set aside for other things. Such dishonest people and no willingness to make things right. I even filed a BBB complaint and they didn’t side with anyone. Not enough to go to court over. There is so much more, but bottom line, we were not happy and definitely do not recommend.

Thanks for the reply. I can post the invoice once I figure out how to. Do you also want to video of your movers fighting on my lawn and the back and forth with the BBB? Or is the bill good enough?

resp.text: Thank you Kat. If we even moved you. Please leave a picture of your bill of lading for all to see so we know this is not a fake review.

text: Called because my other moving company was incompetent. Tyler was awesome.

name: Monika Glennon
text: We just purchased our home and called Kennedy and Sons because they came highly recommended over and over by friends. We were NOT disappointed!! Once we got on their schedule,  the communication was awesome.  They sent people to fix our issue and actually checked in multiple times making sure we were happy with the work. The guys who did the work were amazing. So very professional and keeping us abreast on all they were doing.  They also were kind enough to put up with our dogs 🐕! We highly recommend Kennedy and Sons for all your structural work!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the wonderful review! We are happy to serve and definitely appreciate your patience with our schedule.

name: Brian Mckelvey
text: Don Kennedy and Sons repaired the Lintel over my garage door. The lintel was sagging from the weight of the brick above the garage door. They installed a system they call 'Lintel Lift'. This was the best solution I found for a PERMANENT and good looking repair. It was also approved by my 2-10 Warranty company. Their installation team did the installation in less than a day and it looks perfect. They were professional and left my property in a clean state. I highly recommend them for this permanent solution for a sagging lintel.

name: Dr. Mitch Robertson
text: I contacted Kennedy and Sons regarding structural issues caused by water damaged. Kennedy and Sons immediately contacted me and scheduled and appointment to assess the damage and to estimate the cost to make repairs.. After Terry Kennedy assessed the damage, he wrote a detailed estimate of the cost of repairs for me to submit to my insurance company. He met with the insurance company's adjuster, at their request, to answer their questions regarding the work to be completed. Terry Kennedy was in close contact during the process of insurance approval and the structural work. I would highly recommend Kennedy and Sons.

name: Hannah
text: Josh and Kyle at Don Kennedy and Sons and their team did an installation of a foundation pier system and exterior drain tile system to reinforce the exterior of our home against further settling and damage and move water away from that area. The whole team was very efficient and extremely hard working. We had to adjust the plan a bit as digging revealed issues that could not have been foreseen, the whole team was flexible and rolled with the punches to get the installation completed and make sure it would function well in the long term. We would certainly call them again if we needed their services in the future.

name: Heather Woodard
text: Was very impressed with the professionalism and help that Ian provided me with over the phone. I felt like an appreciated customer and will definitely continue to do business with this company!

name: Len Burton
text: I called to get an evaluation for my foundation. Ian was professional and courteous while setting up my appointment, and answered all questions I had about the process and pricing. The team was quick and professional.

name: Li Major
text: We were very pleased with the quality of the foundation repair and lintel lift service.  The entire team - Tim, Adam, Kyle, Diego and Alex - were very professional and pleasant!  We highly recommend Don Kennedy and Sons Structural Solutions.

name: Brandi Taylor
text: Ian was super helpful and friendly. He was able to answer all my questions and help me figure out a solution to my problem. Highly recommend Fon Kennedy and Sons!

name: Tim Knox
text: As a residential real estate agent my clients are faced with structural issues all the time. There is one company that I call and that is Kennedy & Sons. They are responsive, professional, and I can always count on them to be honest and reliable. When I show my clients a report with the Kennedy & Sons name on it they know they've been served by the best and can rely on the results. I highly recommend Jeff and his team for any structural issues your home may have.

name: Dakota Hancock
text: Great price, great people, and great work all around.

name: Teri Hunt
text: Kennedy and Sons performed foundation work on my home 15 years ago and did a terrific job. In the process of selling my home the inspector recommended an analysis by a structural engineer. I called Kennedy and Sons and, at no charge and within 48 hours, they sent Grant Collins to assess my home. Grant was very professional, courteous and clearly competent. I highly recommend Grant and Kennedy and Sons for this type of work. They are very good to work with and they stand by their work (even when 15 years have elapsed!).

name: Savannah Ann Bull
text: Just wanted to pass on huge kudos to your representative Grant who came out to a house we are looking to buy yesterday.  What a professional and what a nice guy!  He really put us in our comfort zone by telling us the house - basement and crawlspace - was in great shape, tight, no issues.  He did not try to sell us on things we do not need - very hard to find these days!  Grant is an honest and professional broker who WELL represents your company.  He gained you a future client yesterday as we will be back on other properties as we are real estate investors!

name: Tim Lewis
text: Don Kennedy and Sons has worked on my house twice.  The first time it was to correct a foundation "repair" that was botched by another company who would not cover their work.  Kennedy and Sons excavated the old work and tied the piers and our foundation to deep rocks in the mountain, and that part of our house has been solid ever since.  Unfortunately, a different corner of our house needed repair a couple years later, and I called Kennedy and Sons again.  They put in push piers and again tied the foundation to deep rocks.  It remains to be seen how this new work will stand the test of time, but based on the prior work, I'm confident that it will.  The price on the work was very good, and they got to it quickly and were done within a week.  They didn't mess up my property.  When they left, it was surprising to me how well they covered their work, given the amount of digging they'd done.

name: Drew Helveston
text: My wife and I are selling our house and we wanted to see if there were any issues with the foundation.  A friend referred us to Kennedy and Sons Structural Solutions.  My wife called to make an appointment.  They were able to come out the following day which was amazing.  The technician who came out to our house was Grant Collins.  He arrived on time and was a joy to work with.  He took time to listen to our needs, questions, and thoughts.  After he was able to inspect the house, he met back with me and discussed his thoughts regarding our house.  He had his report emailed by the following day.   So to sum it up.  Within three days, we were able to get in touch with a expert who looked over our house, answered our questions, and sent us an emailed report.   Grant is the man and someone we would (and will) definitely recommend.

name: Tara Gibson
text: This is a HORRIBLE company to work with. They did $20,000 worth of work that I later found out I could have had done for $5,000 - my bad, but I was trying to go with a "reputable" company and have a so called lifetime warranty for any future homeowners that bought my home. Now they "can't find where they ever did any work on my home" . And was told that they don't want to be held liable because they can't find where they ever did the work.  Do not use this company. You WILL REGRET IT

text: Didn't do the job right the first time. Took almost a month,  dozens of emails and phone calls to get them to finish.

name: Frankie Cole (snowjr21)
text: I was referred to Don Kennedy and Sons by my selling agent to address foundation issues with the house. It was very pleasant working with them from start to finish on my repairs. All of my questions were answered and the work was completed on schedule and for a reasonable cost. Will certainly recommend them to friends and family for any foundation needs!

name: Kelly Wells
text: I had the best experience with Kennedy and Sons. I purchased a rental house with horrible sagging floors and they were able to raise all of the floors to where they were originally.. On top of that, they guaranteed the work to keep my floors level from settling for 25 YEARS!!!  They kept in contact with me the entire time.  I will only use Kennedy and Sons in the future. They are very honest and they care about customer satisfaction. Prior to hiring them, I had a horrible experience with AFS. Kennedy and Sons came to my rescue!!

text: I had another foundation company come and worked in my basement. Afterwards I started having moisture and efflorescence appear on the floor. I need another opinion and advice so I called Don Kennedy and Sons. They were great to work with and very knowledgeable. Gave me several recommendations and even looked outside the house and found several areas of concern that I did not know. Thanks so much

name: James Wyatt
text:
I have to say that I am genuinely impressed with Kennedy and Sons Structural Solutions. Very innovative and, from what I can tell, a leader in the industry.  I believe their name sums it up.
Our neighbors hired Kennedy to work on their foundation last fall, and we ended up hiring them to fix the droop in the brick above our garage door that had been getting consistently worse for several years. We got estimates from two other companies and the prices were not that far apart.  The reason we chose to go with Kennedy was because of the technique proposed.  As an engineer, it just made the most sense to me. The repair was minimally invasive and took only a few days.  It is hard to find honest and reliable contractors these days, but that is what we found in Kennedy.  The finished product is better than we expected.

name: Michael Osborn
text: Don Kennedy was extremely rude when issues came up and did a very poor job in communicating with me. For the amount of money you are paying a foundation company, you expect great service and these guys will not deliver.

He was prompt, and always answered my calls, in meeting me to discuss what I wanted, and was very helpful with financing the project. Can't wait to see the finished product. Thanks Grant

name: Sonya Hayes
text: Work was done in time frame. Customer service was beyond awful. The workers completely destroyed the yard beyond the need to do the work. Workers were pouring concrete (quick Crete) at 8pm using basically headlamps for light, the work was shoddy we ended having to buy equipment to smooth the surface. Work had to be redone. A worker actually came to the hospital while my husband sat with a family who was going through major family illness  to collect final payment . The work cost 20,000 and cost us at least another 3,000 to make our yard useable again. We sent a pictures via a certified letter expressing our disappointment and requesting some help in fixing the problems a phone call from the owner assuring us he wanted us to be satisfied customers, well he failed. Today after three months we have finally gotten the warranty transferred to the new home owners. This took a three hour drive on our part to see someone face to face. We were given promise after promise that we could handle this via mail. Pick a different company for your foundation work. Oh and the check my husband for warranty transfer at noon today cleared the bank before my husband drove the three hours back home. I have nothing good to say about our experience

DO NOT TRUST  DON KENNEDY AND SONS STRUCTURAL SOLUTIONS, JEFF AND HIS TEAM!!!!!

You can call me at your earliest convenience to discuss the structural issues that still exist, a time for you to come out and/or a date for repair.

3-29-17 Ok sounds great and I am so sorry your problem did not get taken care of. My parents always said that all one can do is hire what we believe to be good Godly character and monitor the results. We did have a couple we let go since your job, and its no excuses for your job to go unsatisfied

BEWARE!!!!! Do not use Don Kennedy and Sons. They know nothing about correcting structural/ foundations. Hired them years ago, paid them and my structural issues still exist. I have been calling them to come and correct my issues and complete

Jeff,
I have to start from the beginning.  Years ago I contacted you for a specific issue. The issue was the floor area around one of my dining room corners was dipping downward. You can out assessed the issue and gave me a price to repair the issue.  You told me that my issue was repaired but it would take time to correct itself. Over what? 10 years? or close to it, the issue was never corrected or never corrected itself.  You are supposed to be the professional concerning foundations. All the work you did or what you had to do doesn't involve me. You did this, or that, MY ORIGINAL ISSUE WITH MY FLOORING STILL EXIST TODAY BUT WORST. Whatever you did under the house, has created another issue, meaning now there is a hump in another area of my flooring, which I pointed out to you. So, your text about it would take 7 working hrs under my house in April, 2017 to correct my original issue with my flooring, and the now hump in another area did and has not happened. I was here when your work team arrived and when then left. You told me while they were working under the house, you would be inside the house directing them and to make sure of leveling.  Well, you were not here to direct so none of that happened and nobody told me to call the office for anything. Attached, is where you try to blame the builder.  I hired you correct my original flooring issue well after the builder.  Your correction should have included ALL THE REPAIRS TO CORRECT my flooring issues whether it what the builder did or did not do RIGHT?  So, here we are 12 May 2017 with my original flooring issues still existing, sagging and humped flooring.  So, Where do we go from here?

name: William McNeese
text:
Don Kennedy and Sons just completed major structural repairs on a home in preparation for a home’s appraisal and inspection for closing. The work involved Foundation Support Piers under brick footings to fix cracks in brick veneer and Stable Lift Piers with 2x8 girders in the crawlspace to fix sagging floors.

Tony was referred to me by my real estate agent and he was absolutely fantastic. Tony came right on time when he said he would be there and his communications were prompt and professional. It was a pleasure to work with Tony during the proposal phase and the work itself. He is technically knowledgeable and dependable. I highly recommend him! He is the reason I contracted with Don Kennedy & Sons.

The foundation support piers did exactly what they were supposed to do. The stair step cracks in the brick closed right up as we had hoped. There was a little more impact to the yard and soil than I had expected, but not a major issue.

The Stable Lift Piers and 2x8 girders also did their job. They are not as elaborate of a solution as the adjustable “Smart Jacks” on top of poured concrete pads from AFS, but they do work and they are a little less expensive. I recommend that consumers understand what they are purchasing on major repairs like this and get someone to help if they don’t. I did an internship with a home inspector, and I have structural improvements at my main residence, so I was able to spot some minor issues which Tony readily and proactively agreed to correct once I explained them on the phone. The laborers came right over, understood my concerns, and fixed them right away. Some additional materials were added at no expense/no questions. I think if Tony had been available to inspect before I did he would have corrected these on his own. My own inspection was prematurely hurried by the office manager – see below.

Administratively this business has some improvements to make. At 2:00 on Friday I was called by the administrative assistant that my work was complete and asking for immediate payment. I kindly asked for a chance to see the work first over the weekend and that I would pay on my way to work first thing Monday morning. I was told that they would have to ask the office mgr. This made sense and I agreed. Surprisingly, Jordan called me back promptly explaining that this was not acceptable per her manager and that I needed to leave my own job and arrange for payment with Jordan ASAP. I immediately left a voice mail for Tony. Thankfully he straightened it all out. I was never given an apology by the office manager.

So, I ran over first thing Saturday morning to inspect and observed the minor corrections needed to be made. The office mgr’s insistence on paying right after they were done Friday seemed underhanded (and downright strange too), but Tony made it all right. The office manager needs to get better at being reasonable conducting business, treating people respectfully, and resolving business issues firsthand with customers. However, administrative assistant Jordan worked very hard to provide great, positive customer service. I remained with the laborers on Saturday to make sure everything was fixed to spec, and it was. The laborers worked hard and were very friendly.

I’d recommend to Don Kennedy and to their customers that a 7-10 business day payment period be part of the contract to allow the customer time to inspect repairs, Tony to inspect, and/or get a buddy to inspect after completion of the work. This will also take a lot of stress off the payment-hungry front office and the customer. I’ve contracted lots of work over the years and I’ve never been pressed for payment so urgently – despite a 50% down payment before starting the work.

In summary I do recommend Don Kennedy & Sons for residential structural repairs and especially if you work with Tony.

name: Eduard Boeckmann
text: Don's crew came out to my house and did exactly the work that i asked for and more. They did a great job!

name: Claire Roth
text:
I would not use them again and will continually tell friends and family about the headache we went through for over a week.

The construction workers are great; however, the owner and crew manager are extremely disorganized. We started calling Wednesday over a potentially huge concern. We finally halted work Monday afternoon since Todd and Jeff were not getting back to us or addressing concerns in a timely manner. Jeff's schedule miraculously cleared up to come address our concerns the very next morning--almost an entire week after first calling!

Overall, my main take away is the lack of communication, especially when spending so much money on foundation work. Our problem was misdiagnosed and we ended up owing more than the estimate as well.

I was shocked because I had heard good things and they were even suggested by our realtor. Needless to say, we're going elsewhere for additional work.

resp.text:
Hello Clair
Thanks for expressing your frustration working with my company.  It is too bad you feel the need to "continually tell friends and family" about this experience but that is certainly your right to do so.
As I discussed with your husband we certainly want to ensure that every customer we serve has a great experience.

I can not do anything to help you by posting on the internet, however,  if we can help you at all please call me directly at (256) 533-1100 and I will do anything I can to help you.

We work hard everyday to ensure the work we do is done right and that all our customers are treated well. I do apologize that we did not meet your expectations. Thank you, Jeff Kennedy Don Kennedy & Sons

text: From beginning to end this was a great experience. William provided an accurate estimate and answered all of our questions in a professional and timely manner. The 2 young men that arrived were on time, professional and very hard working! We had a lot to move and they really exceeded our expectations which says a lot! The work ethic displayed throughout the move has been inspiring and appreciated by our entire family. If you need a move done you will miss out if you do not use Power Moves for it. We have another move to go and plan to use them for it and will be asking for the same 2 young men that did an outstanding job!

name: Herman Myers
text: These two young guys Devin and Joe were amazing. They were on-time and did a professional job of packing up all of the items large and small on my Penske truck. Job well done and I strongly encourage everyone to use them. I will definitely use them again in the future.

name: Alicia Gore
text: We hired them to pack us and they only had to move our things to storage.  We thought our things would only be in storage 2 weeks, but in waiting on the closing of our house , it ended up being 2 months and a week, a circumstance beyond our control.  We contacted Power Movers immediately once we learned of our closing to get them to complete the move, but they were booked.  So we ended up hiring another company.  When the other company began to load their truck from the storage that Power Movers had loaded to the brim, by the way, the new movers were shocked at how much was broken.  Much was broken, but I only mentioned to Power Movers, one thing, the most significant to us, an antique desk that their men had wrapped too tight with plastic and apparently how they lifted it the top had come off.  The new movers pointed this out to us before they touched the peice so that we would know they had not done it.  Will, the owner of Power Movers wouldn’t hear me out while I was trying to relate the situation to him.   He  kept cutting me off while I was talking, tried to accuse the new movers of the damage and even suggested that we had possibly gone in our own storage and caused the damage ourselves when he knew there was no way anyone could have stepped a foot in that storage because they had it packed to the door with no walking room.  Unlike other moving companies that we have dealt with in the past and we were professional movers with the big name movers ourselves, they didn’t want to make good on any damages or even own up to any which is unrealistic. There are usually bound to be some damages in moving.  If they are not prepared to make good on damages, then they shouldn’t be in the business.

name: Lillian R.
text: Moving is an experience we don't enjoy.  However, this company made it painless and worry free.  The movers called once enroute, arrived early and finished on time.  They were able to move bulky furniture without damage to our house or the furniture and fit everything into our storage unit, with space to spare.   Did I mention PowerMoves has competitive pricing? Get your quote from them first!  I'm looking forward to hiring them again when we make our next move.

text: Professional and reliable service at an affordable price! These young men used care, concern and expertise in loading and unloading my boxes and furniture. They went over and beyond to help me!

name: Brenda Gladney
text: Came to Huntsville to help my daughter move, only to find out there were no U-Haul trucks available... I looked on Google for moving companies and came across this company PowerMoves.. They were so ready to take my job at the very last minute. The guys greeted us with a smile. I knew I would have a great experience.. The price was very reasonable and we got excellent service.. They took care of all the stress of moving.. I highly recommend this company for all your moving needs. Thank you so much for your wonderful service...

name: Jodi Hanlon
text:
Unfortunately, I would NOT recommend this company to ANYONE!!!  While the two gentlemen that showed up were very nice and polite, there were items that were on my contract that didn't get moved (which weren't noticed until hours later). I originally had a fridge and dining room table with 8 chairs listed on my contract (in addition to other items) and added a few things to the contract (which I paid extra to be moved).  I was doing a double closing and my son stayed at the house to oversee. I let (showed) the guys know which items needed to be moved. My son was packing up the remainder of the house. When the guys were ready to leave, they did a quick "walk-through" with my son (who didn't know what was on the contract and had other things going on). Upon my return and when we realized they forgot the fridge and 3 chairs, I called the office to let them know so they could return to get the items (my son and I were on a deadline to get out of the house since the house was no longer mine). My son & I got into our respective vehicles (me to drive the 26' U-Haul truck) and headed to Florida. We dropped off the U-Haul and turned around to head back to the old house to get my truck from my neighbor's house (at no time did I hear my phone ring). Upon our return to Florida at 9:30 pm, I checked my phone and received the voicemail from the office stating that they were trying to contact me.  I tried calling back but received no answer. I called them the next morning and figured that since I couldn't get into the old house, I would chalk up the loss of the fridge and just go buy a new one. I received a call from Darius and told him that at this point, I just wanted the bill adjusted to remove the price of the fridge since it was never moved. I was told NO and he started going into well, that's what happens when you add stuff to your contract (which I reminded him that I had PAID for those additional items). Again I stated that I just wanted the bill to be adjusted for the item that they didn't move and that that would be the end of it. I was told that in no uncertain terms were they going to adjust the bill.
AGAIN, VERY UNPROFESSIONAL AND WOULD NEVER, EVER RECOMMEND THIS COMPANY!!!!!!

resp.text: We’re terribly sorry that you feel as though we hadn’t done our complete best to satisfy your move. But, the accusations that you convey are incorrect, fraudulent perhaps. In efforts to keep our integrity at a high standard, allow us to explain our side of the story for our viewers and potential customers. Everything that we mention here will be a reference to the contract that you signed. In the contract that you signed, “line 7” states that we require the customer to be present during the move. Furthermore, we require the customer to inspect each location prior to departure. By this condition alone you have failed to keep up with contract that you signed. You left your son(older gentleman) in charge, whom you now say didn’t know what was on the contract. We as a company have seen this many times before. You left the responsibility of your move into the respected hands of your son whom you trust and we trusted that by your decision to do so, that we would move accordingly. By this shift in responsibility, your son had full authority on what stayed and what go. Also, in “line 7” the customer is responsible for doing a walk through to VERIFY ALL ITEMS are collected and the LOAD PERFORMED MEETS THE APPROVAL OF THE CUSTOMER. In continuance of “line 7”, if the customer fails to do this, any items left behind is the responsibility of the customer. After this Condition of the contract, is where a customer is to initial and your son had done so. Understanding that Mr.Hanlon has full authority since your absence, we decided to not only perform ONE, but TWO walk throughs with Mr.Hanlon. Furthermore, he agreed that everything was loaded up for departure to his new home. And also to mention he paid for ours services. Let’s fast forward. We’re just about done with the unload, assembling and staging furniture with no customer in sight. We received a call about the refrigerator being left behind after the walk through was performed. Our policy states “the customer takes full responsibility of any item(s) left behind after performing a walk through of their home”. Again, we’ve seen this many times before and as the company that we are, we try our best to help even in the events of mishaps. Multiple calls were made to you to pick up the refrigerator after our office received notification that it needed to go. 7 phone calls and a voicemail later to be exact. No answer, No text, No word, or No call from either customer.Forwarding to the next morning. We are a company from a different State and we can not hold our trucks due to our time schedules. We finally received a phone call from you the following morning after we had departed from FL, And after a 12(+) Hr Delay in hopes to attend to your Mistake. You stated that you hadn’t received any phone calls in which we have the phone logs to prove that’s inaccurate.  (The same logs we sent to you personally) Your request for an adjustment towards the bill was denied because of your abominable attitude and perfidious approach. We implore that you motion this situation to the law or the BBB because we have the signed contracts, phone logs and three witnesses to prove the inaccuracy of your statement. We are a company of integrity and we uphold our standard to the best of our ability and we will contest every erroneous statement made against us as well as 1 star ratings. We wish you the very best in your future endeavors Ms.Hanlon.

name: rashad coleman
text: We are very pleased with our experience with Power Moves, and would like to especially mention the two gentleman who made our move easier--Trey & Will. They arrived on time and were careful with our belongings. Both gentlemen were professional, courteous, and extremely helpful. They wrapped and tied down the furniture. Great value for my move. They are true professionals and we greatly appreciate their assistance with our move across town. Thank you, Trey & Will!  I would recommend this company to anybody.

text: These guys are great. Got me moved fast and are very professional. Would definitely recommend to friends

text:
I, Really appreciate this moving company so much. William & his movers took so much stress from us within the move. The workers were efficient, fast, and extremely professional with everything they did. They even made sure to stage the rooms in my house to look nice & Neat , exactly how I wanted.

Thanks so much

name: Timeria Kyser
text: These guys are VERY PROFESSIONAL!!! We recommend them to anyone who wants the job done. They moved us from our house to our home. High Attention to detail, punctual, and very polite. We highly recommend!!!!

They were very professional and knew exactly what I needed. They were friendly, energetic and also patient! Ask them for the wrap! Super cost effective! Everything arrived to our new home on time and in great condition. So thankful I found this moving company!

name: Paul Camp
text: 10 STARS...Where  should I start. These guys are great.  Showed up on time...very professional.  I was going to show them the elevator..they said faster down the stairs.  Other companies  explained that the "elevator" is always the choke point....other people wanting to use it. $$$$$$$$$$ Could have easily added several hundred dollars to our bill. They even carried a 355 lb elec wheelchair down the stairs. Upon arrival at our new place...door jam padded to prevent damage and out comes the RED carpet. There were times when the would "jog" back to the truck for the next piece.  I feared the move due to my significant other's OCD...could not have been smoother.  Next day I discover my elec recliner was assembled wrong and we could not (disabled here) fix it. A email and a phone call saw William, the mgr on his way to our home and 5 min later all good. I don't think you can find anyone that will work haerder and smarter than these guys....  GREAT VALUE  FOR YOUR MONEY

resp.text: Wow! We’re blown away by your review Paul. Thankyou for allowing us to showcase our professionalism as well as our talents. We say, THANK YOU Paul for choosing POWERMOVES!!!

name: Kimberly Starr
text: These guys are awesome! Very polite and professional and handle your items with care!

name: Erika Limberg Pace

text: I wouldn’t recommended these guys.. they give you a price over the phone and when it’s all over they throw in a bunch of other stuff (that shouldn’t been mentioned on the phone) and you’ll end up paying an extra $100-$150.

name: Erick Kelly
text: Power Moves were life savers! After another moving flaked on me I called Power Moves and they came through for me on and professional!

name: Courtney Darsey
text: Great team! The team was referred to me when I had a difficult timeframe other companies couldn’t accommodate. The leader called me multiple times to ensure the moving process would be stress-free, quoted me a reasonable price and kept my last minute move at ease. The delivery team called me when they were commuting to my location, arrived early to the time I requested and excellently packages all my items! I have used multiple moving services and haven’t seen one that had this professionalism, cleanliness and comfort to my situation. They were wonderful and I highly recommend them to anyone who wants a stress-free move. You guys rock, thanks! :)

name: Maya Shanè
text: Swift workers, they're respectful, careful and affordable.. I'll highly recommend to anyone who is moving.

name: andrew ausin
text: Beat moving company in town!

name: Kayla Lisenby
text: This was such a HORRID experience! If you have the option, DO NOT use Budget Truck Rental, and IF you are using Budget, DO NOT rent through this location. At least try and find an actual Budget Rental Agency (rather than an independent contractor like this one) -- when I returned this nightmare to the local Budget Agency, the employees were very clear that often independent contractors rent out trucks without regard to their status simply for the money. Our experience was a NIGHTMARE. The truck was FILTHY and DAMAGED when we picked up - including the driver's side door of the cab hanging precariously with the fender flapping about. The agency simply encouraged documentation of existing damage so we would not be charged for it but were told there were no issues and to take the truck, and because we were under time constraints, we took the rental. The experience was miserable - the truck was dirty, LOUD, and dangerous. It was difficult to ensure the driver's side door was safely closed. In addition, when we hit rain during the drive, the ENTIRE CAB STARTED TO LEAK! Thankfully it didn't rain until the last 1.5 hours of the drive, since that time was spent soaking wet and freezing.  When I reached out to Customer Service, they offered a paltry 20% compensation of the base rental fee only ($44.64 offered, $223.20 rental fee) - between the rental, insurance, taxes and fees, and gasoline, we spent over $500 on this HORRID experience. DO NOT USE.

name: Melody Kernan
text: WHATEVER YOU DO - do not reserve a truck here!!!! You will not get it!! We made a reservation over 2 weeks ago and were called 2 days before our move saying they did not have a truck. Being graduation weekend, there are no more in tuscaloosa. A disgusting company that I'm sorry we ever tried to do business with.

name: Julianna Ducker
text: DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THIS MAN! We booked a truck online because the company said that one was available, and of course their knowledge of his truck availability is based on what he tells them. The truck pick up was scheduled for Saturday morning, at 3:42PM Friday afternoon (just over an hour before closing) he TEXTS us saying that no truck is available, not even the decency to call! We drove out there to talk this problem through with him. He never is in the shop, but expects people to call as the only means of contact. He did answer that call and told us the same thing again, would not even meet us in person. The next day the credit card was charged for a no-show fee! He told us there were no trucks available and refused to give us more help than a U-haul number, and still had the audacity to charge us for not showing up. We DID show up the day before, and we were told there was nothing and no reason to come back in the morning! After seeing the card charge I again went out to the shop, where he again wasn't. He ignored 5 phone calls, a voice message, and a text. Only just after I left (I'm fairly sure he watched me drive away), did he call back and claimed that he had nothing to do with the charge. Maybe a plausible excuse, except there is no way for the company to think we did not show up without his contacting them. Even if they somehow charged the no-show fee another way, it was certainly on him to contact the company that he works under to tell them that he had no trucks to give. DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THIS MAN! ZERO STARS.

name: beaucult
text: This is by far the worst truck rental company I have ever rented from. There should be an option for negative stars because they don't even deserve the one. The owner of this location had nothing ready when I arrived to pick up the truck for a 1700 mile move. He would not even turn the truck around in his junk piled lot. When I went to hook up the auto trailer I rented, the wires were cut and didn't connect to the back of the truck. His solution, twist the wires together to another harness which was cut off another trailer. Very lazy and rude man who has no concern for the customers' safety. This faulty trailer ended up preventing me from leaving on time and caused me an injury. Oh they replaced it after I had my truck loaded but it ended up preventing me from starting my new job on time and then cost me 800 more dollars which this pathetic company called budget charged me for "late" drop off at the destination. This joke of a truck rental company cost me over $2,000 extra and offered no compensation for the malfunctioning truck and trailer they rented me. DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY NOR THIS JOKE LOCATION/ OWNER! YOU WILL SUFFER FOR THEIR INEPTITUDE AND LAZINESS!!!

name: Nuri Ceylan
text: No service no help no no no no no nothing how doo you stay in business like this

name: Jack Obitts
text: I rented a one way 16 foot truck from Alabama to my new home in Florida. The price was an especially good value since I received unlimited mileage during my three day rental. The truck was clean, drove well, and had excellent visibility toward the rear of the vehicle. The Budget truck store owner had my truck ready for pickup at 9:00 am and all I had to do (besides the paperwork), was perform an inspection of the vehicle for any pre-existing damage. But just in case, I purchased the supplementary insurance for covering any vehicle damage during the rental period which was a bit pricey but it gave me a comfortable feeling for a long July 4th weekend run of 235 miles.  By the way, one of the other big truck rental companies only was going to provide a two day rental with limited mileage that would just barely cover the full trip.  So, any route deviation would have resulted in additional expense. And the other rental truck company wanted me to pick up their truck at a location 70 miles from my home!! My only issue for my Budget rental involved a seriously soiled furniture pad which couldn't be used. The other 11 were fine. My turn-in at the Budget rental site in Florida was as I expected - no additional surprises or fees. I will use and recommend Budget for future rentals.

name: Chatting Mrs. Mason
text: My husband and I rented a truck to reload our of state. This has been the worst experience EVER!!! Traveling with my elderly mother, two dogs and being diabetic is stress enough our moving truck broke down hours outside of town.  They sent a repair person hours later and were after a three hour assessment were we’re allowed to go to a hotel. The next morning they towed the truck with our items to a shop to sit for the next day or two. We asked repeatedly to have another vehicle but we’re told that it was not approved. This truck mother board was damaged and had something put in the tank that should not have been placed in it. The truck will take days or a week to be services. I don’t think we should have to be subjected to staying in a hotel for days until they can fix a broken truck. Giving customers a proper running vehicle should be the standard.

name: Deanna Ezell Hallman
text: Great people with great service at this location. I would definitely use them again.

name: Zach Harrison
text: We wish we had read these reviews before. The same thing that happened to several others happened to us. The truck was reserved a week in advance and when it came time to be picked up, there wasn’t one available. Not there or anywhere else. We ended up having to take a truck 10 feet smaller than wanted, and it had 2 check engine lights on. Go somewhere else.

name: Frances Camille Ray
text: Dishonest/Scammers. The Budget website says the liability insurance is optional, but the person there kept insisting it was 'mandatory' and so upped the price 80$. Sad!

name: Victoria Means
text: I feel like if you don't have trucks to rent, why would you have people wasting their time making reservations. This location had no trucks and the workers told me to contact customers service because they didn't know what to tell me. Unprofessional AF!

name: Stephanie Higgs
text: if I could give negative stars I would. READ THE REVIEWS AND BEWARE IF YOU RENT/TRY TO RENT FROM HERE

name: Happy Mommy
text: This has been a terrible experience.  I reserve a truck ten days ahead of my move. This guy calls me the day before my move saying he has no truck.  Moving was quite the challenge, as you can guess.  Then I was still charged $50 on my card as a no show, even though he called me telling me there was no truck available for rental.  I'm still bickering with customer service on this one. I feel like I should be paid for all the legwork I'm doing to get my $50 returned to me.

name: Beverly Chandler
text: Very nice gentleman who rented us our Budget truck.   Definitely would rent from him again.

resp.text: We're so glad to hear this, Beverly Chandler! Thank you for choosing Budget Truck - we hope to rent with you again soon!

name: Brian Yanko
text: Budget itself is a great company to deal with but I will never use this location again. The guy there recommends a Shell up the road for fuel which if you use that Shell the lot is off level to begin with. Fueled the trucked, to the brim even had a little some out. Go to drop off the truck and the guy tells me it's not full and He's going to charge another 30 to fill it up. I've had my CDL for 15 years run tractors, heavy equipment, I took my driving test in a Deuce and a half but I guess I don't know how to operate a fuel pump at this point or the one mile drive ate all of it. STAY AWAY from this location. Take the extra time to rent or drop off somewhere else. What a joke

resp.text: We're very sorry to hear this, Brian. Please call us at 1.800.462.8343 to discuss this further so we can look into it.

name: Emilee Mann
text: Charged us $267 for a 8 hour rental and refused to send me a final receipt! NEVER GO HERE! When we were pre authorized for $84.99

name: Billy Dotson
text: Made a reservation almost three weeks ago and an hour before picking up they call and tell me there are none available and to add on a Saturday. I've called penski uhaul and nothing is available and now have to call the land lord for an extra day and reschedule an interview because nothing is available. If there was an option for zero stars I'd click that. The worst experience I've ever had.

resp.text: We're so sorry for the inconvenience, Billy. Please call us at 1.800.462.8343 so we can look into this and assist you further.

text: Horrible customer service. I reserved a truck from them 3 days in advance and made a deposit. I was specifically told if i did so that I was guaranteed a truck. When I called the day before I was due to pick it up I was told they only had 2 trucks and 5 people wanting to rent. 3 people had applied online after I had made my reservstion and they promised the same trucks to multiple people.

name: stephen patrias
text: I called to make sure he had my reservation (12 foot truck). He said he had it ready to go.  When i got there,  he told me all he had was a 16 foot truck that looked like it was about to break down.  Thankfully,  i made my 1300 mile trip.  I will not do business with this location again.

resp.text: We're so sorry to hear about this experience, stephen patrias. Please call us at 1.800.462.8343 to discuss this further so we can provide you with further assistance.
